results.description:
Brooklyn Breathwork is a monthly gathering that honors the sacred gift of life through the gentle and transformative modality of rebirthing breathwork. 

All evenings are by donation with a suggested donation of $20 per person. We also host special evenings with lightworkers and healers. We are here to create a conscious, sacred and supportive community in the heart of one of the greatest cities in the world. Breathe on with love!

Rebirthing Breathwork, also commonly referred to as rebirthing or conscious connected breathing, is an acceleration of the healing process through an exploration and practice of the breath. Bypassing the mind entirely, the rebirthing breath goes deep into your cells, saturating the body with both oxygen and life force, and helps to release any negative self-thought, perceived limitations, past trauma or any uncomfortable feelings that are held in the body. It is a truly transformational modality that helps the breather recognize their union with their higher self and all of life with peace and absolute love.
results.name: Brooklyn Breathwork

results.description:
Our Meetup Purpose: This is a group for mature Myers-Briggs "iNtuitive Feelers" (NF) who want to meet other intuitive feelers for deeper and more intimate conversations and connections.  Approximately one in ten people fit the NF personality profile.  If you are not sure if you fit the profile, click "Pages" up above, and click on the free test link to take a personality test.  

Our group of NFs will favor positive, uplifting, and inspiring conversations amongst those of us over 30 years old.  It will be a supportive environment where we can learn and grow. I believe that we "idealists" have the most amazing potential to do good in our society. Let's SUPPORT one another in our dreams, our goals, and investing our amazing potential back into our families, our society, and in our world!


What Wikipedia says about us:  "As the identity-seeking temperament, Idealists long for meaningful communication and relationships. They search for profound truths hidden beneath the surface, often expressing themselves in metaphor. Focused on the future, they are enthusiastic about possibilities, and they continually strive for self-renewal and personal growth.

Idealists strive to discover who they are and how they can become their best possible self -- always this quest for self-knowledge and self-improvement drives their imagination - and Idealists yearn to help others make the journey too."
results.name: NYC Idealists - NF (INFP, INFJ, ENFP, ENFJ) meetup (Age 30+)

Racing Club Practica meets every Thursday 9 pm to 12:00 am and Rawson Practica meets every Saturday 2 to 5 pm at Stepping Out Studios, 37 W 26th Street, 9th floor. Rebecca also offers a full program of classes and lessons, and you can read more about those at rebeccatango.com. But this Meetup group is all about practicing at whatever skill level you are currently enjoying, and getting ready to go out to milongas and simply dance, express the music, connect with a partner, and have some intense fun!

results.description:
Whether it's finding a job you love, fixing your relationship, losing 30 pounds or simply being ready for the next exciting chapter in life, the work you do at HG provides immediate inspiration, serious results and lasting knowledge.

Our Life Coaches utilize the Handel Method, which is also the foundation of the work we do in companies such as BASF, The New York Times and Vogue as well as the classes we teach at MIT, NYU and Stanford.

Together we dig deep, play big and don’t stop until goals are fulfilled and lessons learned. We care, we love what we do and we walk our talk.


The Handel Method®

The Handel Method® was created by Handel Group® co-founder Lauren Zander over the past 15 years. The method is the foundation for courses we teach at institutions such as MIT, NYU and Stanford, the work we do within companies such as AOL, BASF, Sony, BP, and The New York Times, and the coaching that we provide to individuals. The method is revolutionary yet easy to understand, methodical yet customizable. The Handel Method® is based on a belief in the power of speaking the truth, and in Personal Integrity® as the most direct avenue toward creating permanent change in any area of life. We work with clients to address their fears, thoughts, and negative beliefs so that they are free to invent a life they love.


For more information on the Handel Group, please visit

http://handelgroup.com
results.name: Handel Group Life Coaches

results.description:
This group was created for career changers.  The group would consist of getting like-minded individuals together to share your work-life experiences, network for potential job offers and provide a network support mechanism while in school. We will get together to discuss our progress, the up’s and down’s of going back to school and your experience in trying to land a job, in your new chosen field.  

This group caters to those who already have a college degree, but have been in their job too long or working in the same field for some time. You have been contemplating making a career move and now you are in that transition, in getting another degree. This group is for those working full-time jobs, all the while pursuing a second or third degree; unrelated to what you are doing at the moment.

If I can further illuminate the need for a support network, this article will emphasize this further.  We all want to succeed, let's do it together!!
results.name: New York Career Changers

results.description:
Hey All! 


I host poker games in Kearny, or sometimes at a location near the Newark bridge in Harrison, NJ. Right now we play $1-2 No Limit Hold'em with the ocassional rotation of $1-2 Pot Limit Omaha IF NO ONE OBJECTS. This means if you are uncomfortable playing Omaha, then the crew is okay with playing Texas all night. Depending on the location, I will either be using my custom-made full sized 10 handed poker table or a smaller 9 max table. 


What is guaranteed are: comfy chairs, custom ceramic chips and Gemaco cards. Drinks/Snacks are always provided, and occasionally we will have catered food . The game for the most part is full of mid 20 year old players. This game started off as a 25-50 cent game a few years ago that evolved over the years into a full ring $1-2 game. If you want to join us EMAIL me with your NAME and PHONE# 


Text/Call (973) 771-6775 or NJPokerMadness@gmail.com for more information!
results.name: Hudson County NJ Poker Madness

topics.name: Practicing the early stages of Argentine Tango

results.description:
Welcome at Ultimate Tango!

Here you find all you need to become a true member of Tango community. We focus on developing in you the truth understanding of what Tango is.

Tango is not just a dance. It’s philosophy, the way of comprehending the world, the way of building relationships, the way to understand yourself.

Here at Ultimate Tango we teach you the tango alphabet, we teach you how to create words, we teach you basic rules, basic steps, basic combinations. We teach you all you need to know about music, connection, lead and follow, types of tangos and more. From there you can launch onto your own journey to discover what Tango means for you. 

We don’t want to limit you with multitude of steps and clatter your memory with combinations you can never remember. Our goal is to give you the true understanding of Tango structure and music, mechanics of the movement, technique and cadence. From there you can start improvising on you own. Find your own style.

We offer carefully structured courses in Tango, Vals and Milonga at 3 different levels – beginner, intermediate, advanced at 3 different locations: New York City NY, West New York NJ and Boston MA. We also offer workshops to address more specialized topics. Private lessons are available for those who wish to progress at their own pace.

DON'T REPEAT MINDLESSLY. LEARN THROUGH UNDERSTANDING.
results.name: Ultimate Tango NYC Meetup

results.description:
• Are you tired of  eating at "table for 1" restaurants

• Going to bars by yourself

• Not having anyone to talk to after a hard day of work, or

• Just needing someone to motivate you when your feeling totally out of it,

• Want to meet people that want to earn extra money as much as you do

THEN THIS IS THE GROUP FOR YOU!

Inclusive ladies, are for women who really want to build themselves financially, physically, and emotionally. This group is designed to be like a sorority without the hazing and the pettiness.

Expectations:

• Must attend at least one event to be a member

• Members are expected to know and keep in touch with each other in person NOT through THE  NO SEEING OR NO HEARING NETWORK

• Paying dues  only $5 for the whole year 

( ABOUT DUES) In comparison, to other popular meetups where you have to pay for every meet up and every event, our dues are reasonable; and you would get so much more out of this group. For example: there will be opportunities to learn how to make more money and to truly learn how to bond within a sister hood. 

With other meetups,If your hanging with them very frequently, you could be paying $10 - $15 for every event. That's a lot of money to hang out with people you don't know and won't get an opportunity to bond with. Some meetups even charge to hang out at the museum; when it is free to hang out at the museum.

 I know this because I receive notices from every meetup and meetup are very rarely free. I could easily spend$40 or more on just two events; which doesn't include food or drinks at any of their events.

I truly want to make Inclusive Ladies a meetup for women who want to bond and  not spend, an arm and a leg, to hang with great people.

If you believe in my concept and believe you want to promote a group that would be fun, then I'm encouraging you to join.

If you cant afford the $5.00 or you are not comfortable spending $5.00 on an awesome group. 

Then at least come to a members meeting. I will fill you in what Inclusive ladies as to offer and

 HOW YOU CAN HELP MAKE  INCLUSIVE LADIES A MEETUP FOR GREAT MEMBERS.  

If you have any questions comments and concerns . Please call me at 718-600-4029. Sabrina

What Inclusive ladies are looking for are active and participating members in our activities,                      a great attitude, an open mind, and a willingness to help maintain this inclusive network of loving, caring, and fearless women.

Inclusive ladies .....Where being a lady means being completely satisfied.

SO SIGN UP NOW .... WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR

results.description:
Sorry for this group being in "Private" setting.  We value members' privacy.  I'm sure you wouldn't expect anything less!  

These days in New York City, we have seen some dramatic increase in number of AM/WF couple and more AM/WF couples have placed wedding notices in New York Times. Yet, when this Meetup group was originally formed in early 2012, aside from us, there were NO Meetup that specifically supports AM/WF couple or singles who are interested in getting into AM/WF relationship. Through various activities such as brunch, dinner, movie, party,discussions or other outdoor activities, we hope this group, as a pioneer in this niche group, will aspire more people to be a part of this specific community or be open to this type of relationship.

IMPORTANT NOTE: In ongoing efforts to balance AM/WF ratio, if you are AM, there MIGHT be a wait before approval. WF will be approved rather quickly, unless we feel that she wouldn't be able to find any match in this group. This waitlist is not necessarily a first come, first serve.

Couples are welcomed, as long as they are AM/WF couple. Please reference each other when you "apply". Thanks.

results.description:
If you are interested in more high brow experiences and group of sophisticated, fabulous, accomplished, positive and well heeled women to do it with, this group is for you. You are welcome to join this group if you are a woman age 30 to 45, and professional and accomplished in academic and career achievements.  However, we will not be spending our time talking shop, only connecting socially with like-minded individuals.  Single or married.....you are welcome. 

This group is all about premium experiences and that means dining at the best restaurants, great seats at cultural (opera, ballet, Broadway) and sporting events, charity and social outings, spa days, travel to unique destinations (international and domestic) and/or for once in a life time experiences. All members are encouraged to propose ideas for group events (and even set up/host a few).  

Acceptance into this group is very selective, and decisions will be made based on your (thoughtful) responses to the profile questions.  Profile pictures are required, once approved you can remove them if you wish.

Our outings/events will likely cost upwards of $100 in many cases, so please keep this in mind.  This is a warm and friendly group, but engagement on some level is required and no-shows will be removed.

results.description: This group is for anyone who loves art and especially Russian-French artist Marc Chagall. We agree with Pablo Picasso when he remarked "When Matisse dies, Chagall will be the only painter left who understands what colour really is." This group is dedicated to seeing Chagall's works on display, group discussions about, and meet with art experts and historians to learn more about Chagall.

results.description: I'm a writer, director, producer at Cutrush.com. Unfortunately, I have many jobs that don't allow me to shoot as frequently as I'd like. So, let's make short scenes during the week, for fun. The plan (1) I write a very short simple screenplay (1-2 pages) to be shot in an hour, or pull one from this community (2) find a Manhattan location and time to meet (3) I get together with a few actors, from this community, and we shoot this thing over our lunch break (4) edit and ship it. If you're an experienced actor, skilled screen writer, or an editor looking to experiment like this, please join.
results.name: NYC make a film scene during your lunch break

results.description:
Teach + Learn, Actually Networking.

We are a conscious community of professionals and entrepreneurs who freely share our resources and ourselves. Real conversations with people of all industries with one common goal: success through networking.

Members of our conscious community hold two principles true:

1) Success at work and in business is measured by the quality of their connections, so they actively share access to information, resources, and contacts with other members of the community
2) Success first begins with a focus on personal and professional development. We support each other through the improvement of our business and work skills.

No high pressure sales pitches or hidden agendas! Teach + Learn promotes RELATIONSHIP BUILDING instead of passing out business cards.

Professionals of all ages, abilities, and industries are WELCOME! We believe that the key to success is having people of all backgrounds in your network.

Our networking is FACILITATED. Make the most of your mingling with ice breakers and other activities to keep the conversation rolling.

Our community is free to join and even better when you participate in the conversation. Join us at an event or become part of our free secret Facebook page to have direct access to job posts, expert career advice, and professional development materials.

Looking forward to teaching and learning with you!
results.name: Teach + Learn: CNJ Chapter

Come geek out with us!

results.description:
We’ve all had the experience of feeling socially confident...sometimes it’s there, sometimes it isn’t. What is that feeling? Why do some people just have that magnetic glow? Other times we try, but feel disconnected and don’t know why.  This is a group to discuss these topics - as well as a place to come and hang out! Feel free to bring a book, game, computer, or object of choice. Join the circle chat or just hang around. Our vision is to create an atmosphere of safety that invites playful connections.  We will explore topics such as: what it means to have ‘inherent belonging’, the importance of play in creating safety, and the energetic benefits of music.

https://www.haikudeck.com/title-education-presentation-OxFxFVF7aW#

results.description:
Greetings Heroes,

Welcome to our official home on meetup.com! eSports Heroes is a global organization of gamers who care deeply about the growing world of electronic sports. Over the last decade, online gaming has become a staple of modern life. Thus, professional gaming has exploded in popularity. The world of eSports is an uncharted, untapped frontier from which we can establish ourselves as early adopters.

eSports Heroes of NYC is the original ESH chapter. We are an ambitious group of like minded professionals who care deeply about the advancement of this industry and will help spearhead this movement to make eSports synonymous with sports. 

If you are interested in making new friends, forging professional relationships, and becoming part of this growing industry feel free to join. 

Currently supported games include:  Starcraft - World of Warcraft - Hearthstone - Heroes of the Storm - Counter Strike - Call of Duty - Dota - League of Legends - Super Smash Bros

Members are eligible for the following meetups: Tournaments / LAN Events - Industry Trade Shows - Meet the Pros - Pro Gaming Workshops - Impromptu Gaming Sessions - Hearthstone Fireside Gatherings - Domestic / International Field Trips - Food & Fellowship. 

Potential ESH sponsorship are available to gamers who show exceptional skill or dedication to their craft.

If you are interested in founding your own eSports Heroes chapter we have developed the infrastructure to support you. Please fill out an application on our website: 

eSports Hero

results.description:
Hello cinephiles!  If you love movies, eating and talking....our meetup is for you! We have a nice group of people where everyone is friendly and no one is left out. At our events, we end up with great discussions and lots of laughs. I decided to start my own meet up after attending many that were not inclusive or friendly.  I am a movie obsessed woman living in North NJ. I adore great films and even more, sharing my opinions, hearing other's opinions and having lively discussions about movies. I would love to gather together other movie buffs to see movies in a theater and then do brunch, lunch or dinners where we talk about the film and just have fun. Everyone is welcome, the only thing you need is a love of movies, an opinion to share and a sense of humor! This meet up will take suggestions and opinions for movies and places to eat. I would say if you live in North NJ in Bergen, Essex or Hudson County that would be convenient. See you at the movies!

Note: I appreciate yearly dues of $5.00 which are given to me at first meetup.

If you RSVP and do not show up and do not notify us, you will be removed. Sometimes we have reservations so we need an accurate head count. Also, please let us know if you cannot come so we don't end up waiting for you at the theater.

Looking forward to meeting you!

To keep groups manageable and to encourage interaction between members, events will typically be capped at 14 people.  Given the small size, to be fair to all, we have a strict no- flake policy. Also, to keep this a friendly community, I don't approve people who don't have profile pictures. Hope to see you at one of our meetings!

results.description:
About Team In Training

Our athletes have walked away with new friends, amazing accomplishments and the sense that they did something even more important than getting in good shape. How serious is blood cancer? Every three minutes, someone new is diagnosed with blood cancer. Every 10 minutes, someone dies. In exchange for training and support, you help raise money towards cures for blood cancers leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin’s disease and myeloma -- the No. 1 disease killer of children is leukemia.

The Reason Why

• Coaching and training. Travel to a major marathon, half marathon, century, hiking adventure or triathlon in exciting locations.

• The opportunity to make your athletic goals a reality (an unbeatable offer with great personal rewards).

• A connection with an honored patient so you know just who and what you’re doing it all for.

As the largest endurance sports training program in the world, we will provide you with the experience of a lifetime.

Events 

If you’ve ever wanted to run, walk, or run/walk 26.2, 13.1, or 6.2 miles, now is your chance to join the TEAM that is saving lives. Visit our website at http://www.teamintraining.org/nj/ for a current listing of our Fall and Winter season events.

Contact

Please contact Margo Cianchetta at margarita.cianchetta@lls.org or 908.956.6628, or visit http://www.teamintraining.org/nj/ for more information.

GO TEAM!
results.name: Get Fit, Have Fun, and Help Cure Cancer!

results.description:
Looking to spend more time in Bay Ridge? I am, having returned to Brooklyn after a decade in Queens! Perhaps, like me, you do a lot in Manhattan, but wish you could also just hang around the neighborhood with new friends. We'll be brunching, lunching, and dining in various restaurants in Bay Ridge, as well as going to local community-building events, like concerts and fairs. While the focus will be here in Bay Ridge, we will venture off to venues in other parts of Brooklyn, like the Brooklyn Museum and the Heights Players. Membership is NOT limited to only those living in Bay Ridge or even Brooklyn, so those "out on the island" or in one of the other boroughs are welcome, too!

While this is a brand-new group, I have been running Meetup groups since 2008, so I've learned a lot of things!  For instance, similar to most meetups, "The (Mostly) Bay Ridge Neighbors" has a modest $1 organizing fee per event, payable to me at the start of an event, to offset the subscription cost of maintaining the meetup.

Please note our No-Show Policy: Because we've been kept waiting in lobbies, etc., for folks who didn't bother to change their rsvps, "The (Mostly) Bay Ridge Neighbors"  has a "no-show" policy where any member who incurs ONE no-show with no explanatory emails to me will be permanently removed from our membership rolls and not be allowed to rsvp for any more of our events. After all, would you keep a "friend" who stood you up and never apologized? Let's all respect each other's time and enjoy ourselves with a minimum of discomfort.

Like what you see about "The (Mostly) Bay Ridge Neighbors "? Then consider joining our sister groups, "Great Places in Gotham" (http://www.meetup.com/The-Great-Places-in-Gotham-Meetup/) , which focuses primarily on Manhattan events and museums, and "Friendly Native New Yorker Walking Tours" (http://www.meetup.com/Friendly-Native-New-Yorker-Walking-Tours/), where as a licensed NYC tour guide, I lead various walking tours in Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Queens!
results.name: The (Mostly!) Bay Ridge Neighbors Meetup

results.description:
This is a group for people who are interested in learning, relearning, reading in, and speaking classical Latin, the language spoken by the ancient Romans. We're working our way through Hans Ørberg's Lingua Latína per sé illustráta, along with some more advanced reading, and teaching ourselves to speak Latin as we go!

Note: Latin learners of all  levels are welcome. Most of us are beginners.


Hic cupientibus circulus est discere, dénuó discere, loquí linguá Latína quá Rómání antíquí locútí sunt. Libró Hánsis Ørbergis illábórámus Linguá Latíná per sé illustrátá, quibusdam aliís cum léctiunculís, nóbís simul nós loquí docentibus.

N.B.: Discipulí omnés sunt acceptí, nec perítia réfert. Plúrimus nostrum tírónés sumus. 

Sí erró, quæsó, mé corrige!
results.name: Circulus Latínus Noveborácénsis (New York Latin Circle)

results.description:
This is not a sit around group, this is trial by fire. If you want to get involved in video production, and are an adult of sound mind and body this may be for you. We meet to voluntarily exchange media and production work.

The rules:

RULE #1: You are not a participant, you are a reporter of the news, you do not place your self in danger, you do not place others in danger, you do not personally comment on situations or editorialize, you cover others at the event talking. They are the subject, not any of us in the meetup.

RULE #2: If you want to make sure what you want get's published, either publish it your self on social media, or, convince someone in the group or outside of the group to publish. Just because you are part of the group, does not mean anyone has any obligation to contribute to your work. This is a loosely based meetup.

RULE #3: Bring your skills. If you like being a reporter, if you want to do audio engineering, if you want to write music with true current social meaning, then this is an opportunity.

RULE #4: Try to share your skills with others, there will always be video to produce, if you want to do video production, audio production, anything in the stream to create a news worthy news piece, this is your opportunity.

RULE #5: Do this because you enjoy it, try to have fun, help others, try make meaning of the chaos.

RULE #6: We attend public meeting using Open Meeting Law, in New Jersey this means you can only video speakers or officials, due to NJ draconian laws the public in a meeting has a 'right to privacy' at a meeting. In New York all present at meeting may be recorded.  Recording can not interfere with an orderly meeting. NOTE: Every meeting will generate media to produce, I will generate it and provide it under Creative Commons, so if you are downstream of Video and Audio capture, don't worry, you will always have at least my work to work with.

I started this group when I found out that out of a city of 6+ million, there was no planned coverage of THE Post Ambrose LNG public hearing in Queens. It does not matter if you are a Conservative, Liberal, Progressive or any other affiliation. If you want to get involved with video production, this is an opportunity. For my personal work, I always publish creative commons, unless I included copy write material granted to me specifically for my production. Musicians and Sound engineers are badly needed.

FYI

BE PREPARED! 

Federal and State hearings for unpopular infrastructure projects happen many times in the dead of winter, on the coldest evening with virtually no public transit access.  When I was at the Queens meeting it was dark and in the teens,  I could not imagine any elderly person or sane person taking a multi-link trip to that location, and saw none waiting at bus stop.

If you want to be on the short list of people to be notified of short notice events, contact me.  I always announce on the website, but sometimes less than 24 hours are given in advance notice.
results.name: (All Volunteer) Independent News Media

results.description:
Want more out of life? Our mission is to create more fun, freedom and fulfillment in the lives of EVERYONE. Admit it, you are either in dire need of fun or you love to have fun. What better way to exercise that fun bone than traveling the world with friends and family, meeting some fun and amazing people, and participating in fun filled excursions. Best part about it is that you decide what fun is for you. What does freedom mean to you? Freedom from mediocrity. Maybe you are time broke, always working and never have time with family. Maybe you have too much time and no money to do the things you love to do. Everyone could use a little extra money or a lot of extra money. One thing is for sure, we would all love more quality time with family and friends. You decide what you would like to be free from or free to do. Here's my favorite part of what we are centered around; fulfillment. What would make you feel fulfilled in life? What are your dreams and aspirations in life? What if you surrounded yourself around goal-oriented, ambitious and hard-working individuals, is it safe to say your lifestyle will change for the better? Better yet, is it safe to say you become who you surround yourself around? If after answering these questions you have even an ounce of curiosity or interest than you are who we are looking for. See you soon on the beaches of the world!! LETS CONNECT...

<br>

any questions contact me 646-228-7922

<br>

We look forward to meeting you soon!

Yours Truly,

Salome

results.description:
Food and Drink Adventures is geared towards thirty-somethings who want to explore the culinary and nightlife playground that is New York. More than just a drinking and dining-out group, this group is about learning and experiencing all that we consume--as it relates to culture, heritage, history and so much more! 

A few things to note: 

1) Events: All events will be designed to foster friendship.  Dinners will not have large attendance lists, whereas happy hours will not be capped.  

2) Age: This group is intended for people in their 30's.  I'd appreciate it if you respect that. 

3) In an effort to stem the amount of people who RSVP and fail to show up, I’m going to implement the following policy for any person who RSVPs for the 1st time to an event that has a set reservation number and has not shown up to any past events:

When you RSVP as a 1st Timer, I will send you a message to confirm that you will be attending the event. To confirm, simply respond to my message within 48 hours, and you’ll remain on the RSVP list. In the event I do not hear back from you within those 48 hours, if there’s a wait-list, I will remove you from the RSVP list to have someone from the wait-list take your spot.

So please be sure you have your meetup settings allowing me as organizer to send you messages through meetup directly.

4) Removal: If you’re been a member of the group for six months and haven’t RSVP’d or attended a single event, then I reserve the right to remove you from the group. I know that there are a ton of meetup options for one to partake in this great city, but I hope that if you signed up for this group, you’re genuinely interested in giving it a shot – stop by for a drink at one the the next happy hours, or take a chance and try a new cuisine while meeting some new folks. 

Also, if you've RSVP'd to at least 2 meetups, and fail to show up without changing your RSVP and/or notifying me of your absence, I reserve the right to remove you from the group. C'mon, guys - it takes 2 seconds to change your RSVP and/or notify me - I don't have the patience for flaky people - feel free to join another group that will tolerate such behavior.

5) Fees: I think it's lame that meetup has fees to begin with and hasn't figured out a way to generate revenue without holding Head Organizers liable for such costs, but it is what it is...with that being said, I'm not sure if there will be a nominal fee for meetups at some later point in time - as I just took over for the previous organizer, I'm still trying to figure this out.

If all this sounds good to you, then join us! :)
results.name: Food and Drink Adventures (30s)

results.description:
This is a group for girls who live in Greenpoint and Williamsburg. Meetups will include a little bit of everything - dinners, happy hours, fitness activities, shopping, galleries, coffee, festivals, and more! Girls in this group should be in their 20s and 30s only, no exceptions. Most events will have attendance limits, because it's easier to get to know each other in a smaller group! However, don't be discouraged by the waitlist - people tend to cancel in the days right before the event, so you definitely can make it into the events from the waitlist! Inactive members are subject to removal, so please try to make it to some of the events! **I will frequently remove all members who have not even looked at the group page in over a month.** This group will remain small, so we're all able to get to know each other!

*Attendance Policy:

*Respect and consideration for others are Top Priority; be considerate by refraining from being a "NO SHOW" (Not showing up and leaving your RSVP a "yes", or changing RSVP to a "no" within 2 hours of an event and not communicating with the organizer) or a "LATE CANCEL" (Cancelling out of an event within 24 hrs of the event).

*Events take work for organizers to coordinate, especially those requiring RSVPs. Make sure you are able to make it to an event to which you RSVP and if you anticipate a conflict or being late, give us a heads up. We understand that things come up and life interferes, but please do your best. ;)

*If you find that you can't make it to something you've signed up for -- CHANGE YOUR RSVP as soon as possible, or call/text/message an organizer/event host if it is within 2 hours of the event. Events take time & energy to plan. If you don't show up AND make no effort to let the Event Planner know what happened --- that's a "NO SHOW".

*No Show/Late Cancel policy: If you have a history of doing this (we keep track of attendance on your profile), we won't be able to count on you to show up when you say you are going to. Out of respect and courtesy to others that DO show up, we may bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space in favor of those with a positive attendance history. If you make a habit out of no showing or late cancelling, we may remove you from the group.
results.name: Greenpoint Girls

results.description: This meetup is for single, Jewish gay men in their 30's, 40's and 50's. Our purpose is simple: to be a place where single Jewish gay men can meet in fun, no-pressure, no non-sense environments so that they can find that special Jewish someone. For too long, too many Jewish gay men ended up dating non-Jewish men because (a) there aren't that many of out there to begin with;  and (b) with gay couples, starting a family and having a "Jewish home," was not as much a priority as for a heterosexual couple. But now that's changing. More gay couples are starting families. We strive to be an alternative to those events around the City where supposedly one can meet gay Jewish men, but which can be a bit clique-ish (and also very expensive). We also limit our membership to men who are ADULTS - we will take men in their early 30's, but our IDEAL range is really mid-to-late-30's, 40's and 50's.
results.name: NYC Gay Jewish Single Men 30's - 50's

The juices are fresh, simple, healthy, cheap, and extremely satisfying. The beaches are the loveliest in the world and full of Mexican, North/Central/South American, and world citizens. It has the odd but beguiling balance of off the grid feel  along with high-end fashion and hippie sensibility. If your heart is pure so is Tulum

results.description:
Every day, all across the globe 19 MILLION people share a birthday. 
What if every single day people from every nation used their birthday to do something different...something for someone else?
A friend in need. 
A neighbor. 
A stranger.
The person in line behind you at the store, the coffee shop, the drive-thru. 
What if BIRTHDAYS became less about getting stuff, getting attention, getting drunk and getting older and more about MAKING THE WORLD A BETTER PLACE?

**We will meet once a month to celebrate each other's birthdays by spreading kindness all over NYC!**
For more information on how this GLOBAL movement got started and what people all over the world are doing to celebrate their birthdays:
http://web.archive.org/web/20121227105314/http://mixmingleglow.com/blog/?p=1358
http://youtu.be/hn9u7zmTzXU
https://www.facebook.com/TheBirthdayProject/info?tab=page_info

Football is a truly amazing game and sports phenomenon -- let's get to know it better together.

results.description: Do you enjoy reading literary novels and short story collections shortly after they are released? Then this is the group for you. We will focus on books published during the calendar year, or in the early months of the year, late the previous year. (In most cases, books no older than six to eight months, with room for exceptions.) In our reading, I hope we can find books that may win the Pulitzer or other literary awards and thus possibly be talked about for years to come.
results.name: Brooklyn Recent Literary Fiction (or Searching for Pulitzer)

results.description: We all have knowledge and talents to share- so let's get together and teach and learn from each other! This is an opportunity to build a community through a "smorgasbord of knowledge" that we constantly create. The idea is simple: Every two weeks we will meet to experience something led by one of the members of the group. We will each have an opportunity to sign up to teach a topic, lead a workshop, give a lecture or anything in between for up to 45 minutes. This is a chance to try new things and have different experiences that we hope, in turn, will build community. As members of this group we have one goal: to help grow our community of knowledge by sharing of ourselves and of course, have fun in the process! That means simply participating or signing up to lead us in a presentation. Is there anything you've always wanted to try but never did or a way you've wanted to push yourself, or something you love deeply that you wish you did more? Anything can be the theme of your presentation to the group- from a juggling workshop to a lecture on evolution to a story of your travels to origami- what matters is that you bring something to the group that you love and are excited to share. On your assigned presentation week please be sure to come prepared with any materials you might need and of course let the group know if anything should be done in advance. Then  the rest of us will learn, grow, and be enriched....until it's our turn to present and enrich others! And don't forget everyone bring your favorite wine or beer to share with the group for some mingling after the presentation!
results.name: Brooklyn Knowledge Smorgasbord

results.description:

results.description:
No matter if you're dating or married, as long as you're a couple here in Brooklyn, this group is for you! I would say our general population will be in their 20s & 30s. Most of our meetups will be centralized in the Park Slope and South Brooklyn area, but we'll always go wherever the good times take us. Happy hours are a must, but we'll hopefully be doing everything from beer/wine tastings, food anything, music/shows, comedy, and absolutely some of the great outdoors. We started this group because we have lived in Park Slope for one year now and we're still looking for (a lack of better words) some really rad couples that share similar interests and want to have some fun! Let's be adventurous, enjoy what our local surroundings have to offer and meet some cool couples to share some laughs and adventures with! All meetup suggestions welcome and we hope to meet you soon!

**If you do not participate in a Meetup event with us in the first 60 days of joining the group, your membership will be revoked.**

Rules:

1. Members are require to participated preferably in person, but if unavailable members can participated online! 

2. Members that RSVP three times but do not show up will be remove from the group!

Events include informative topics to learn more about our own empowerment through better management of our broader Worth which includes - finances, fashion, fitness, friendship, spirit and health.
results.name: Women & Worth

topics.name: The Impact of Lyme on your Life

results.description:
" But you look so good?"  Sound familiar?  Lyme disease is one of the "invisible diseases" and often lyme patients suffer consequences of "not looking sick" - jobs are lost, family and friends don't understand, doctors don't believe you or want to treat you, etc., etc. In addition, Lyme Patients often, due to crushing fatigue and pain, find themselves alone and isolated unable to go to work or socialize, which can negatively impact one's ability to recover.

This group is Open to Lyme Disease Patients and Friends and Family of Lyme Patients for the purpose of establishing a community of support and creating a safe venue for sharing experiences, challenges, information and camaraderie.  Located on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, the meetings are facilitated by an acupuncturist, sound healer and experienced meditator, who is also diagnosed with neurological lyme. Sessions will include guided-meditation, group discussion and possibly sound/music therapy.
results.name: NYC Lyme Disease Support Group

topics.name: Welcome to our Paraglider-Hang glider group!

results.description: Calling experienced and newbie hang gliders in New York City. Let's learn from each other as we explore the region's hang gliding scene. What are the best schools, air fields, and more? Urban beginners in particular can benefit from veteran pilots' wisdom. Join the gang for comradeship about the most thrilling pastime.
results.name: NYC Hanggliders

results.description:
This is a group consisting of individuals interested in discovering how to walk through various NYC streets and look for how to "read" the streets for interesting architectural and historic facts. As a licensed NYC Tour Guide, I will show you how to detect a specific historic block, and then we'll  determine the reason that block is "historic". We'll them move onto other sites where I'll share some stories you in turn can share with your friends(who aren't lucky enough to have joined the group).

I started this group as I wanted to share my knowledge with New Yorkers(native or new) during my slow winter season when I'm not as busy with foreigners and student groups. Since one  of my hobbies is photography, we'll definitely stop by some spots where you can take "bug eye" or "bird's eye" photos and truly realize how those descriptors came about…In fact, as we walk, you may end up suggesting and sharing with the group a better photo ops that the ones I have planned!

 My goal is for all of us to have fun and take away  lasting memories from our time together exploring New York. An extra  bonus would be if some of you decide to meet again (either in a group setting or just an informal twosome), but there are no guarantees. HOWEVER, at the end of the walk, I plan on enjoying a  a low cost snack in an  indoor public space. I hope you all decide to join me for our "Apres Walk"(i.e. my version of "Apres Ski" fun). Incidentally,  you can either bring something with you or purchase something along the way. 

I'll also be happy to share with you info on some  other upcoming   low cost/freebie events/venues for the coming week. I hope you can also  share some other FREEBIE events info with our group. For example, after a Friday walk in  midtown Manhattan, I can direct you to 2 midtown museums where on  Fridays 1 is FREE and the other is "pay-as-you-wish" night. 



The $15 charge per person is to help cover administrative costs. You still will be getting a tour very similar to  my $250 private tours.

Thank you for becoming a member and I hope you join some  of our tours soon!

results.description: Sick of feeling alone? Feeling like you're the only one who knows what it's like to lose a boyfriend, girlfriend, husband, wife, family or friend suddenly? Maybe there aren't many of us out there, because most of the time it doesn't feel like there are. If you're someone who has lost your loved one suddenly (i.e. tragic accident, cancer, etc.), please join this group. You're not alone, I promise you. My boyfriend was killed in a car accident and I've also lost my father to cancer. There isn't a day that goes by I don't think of this, and not a relationship I attempt to start it doesn't affect. I find myself pushing away others simply because they don't understand what it's like to lose someone so suddenly you were prepared to spend the rest of your life with. Let's get together, lean on each other, and help one another get back out there without the anger and hurt.
results.name: Sudden Death of a Loved One  - People Who Get It

results.description:
This workshop introduces performing techniques that business professionals can start using to master the “soft” skills that many companies are seeking – creativity, communication, teamwork, leadership and strong interpersonal skills.

Objectives
1. Use performing techniques to improve your charisma and presence.
2. Learn to stretch your comfort zone and manage stage fright. Take risks. Think creatively. Think fast on your feet.
3. Discover how to market yourself to colleges or employers. What makes you unique? Gain new awareness of your public persona.

Details
Each workshop is different and may focus on new skills or build upon previous exercises. We provide a supportive environment for beginners.

The workshop may start out with a guided vocal and physical warm up. The awakening of vocal resonators and energizing the body will make you grounded in any job interview or business presentation.

We may do a series of improvisational acting exercises geared towards getting you out of your comfort zone to create characters, stories and conflict within a scene on the spot. This gears you for being quick on your feet and thinking fast in the work place, and also gets people out of their comfort zone as they create these quirky and extroverted characters.

Other exercises will involve using all these acting tools in a business setting.

For meet up members the price is $20 per class. If you would like unlimited monthly classes for $49, please check out https://bookeo.com/academyonbroadway/signup

For more workshops, check out www.academyonbroadway.com

If you are a Creative Entrepreneur who wants to grow your business, this group is for you! In this group we will discuss our businesses, analyze what is working, what is not, and brainstorm ways to improve and excel at our businesses. If you currently run, have or are starting a small growing business, I hope you will join us! This group is also for women who are thinking about how to find your life purpose, and creatively turn your passion into your income!

 In this group we will learn from each other,  support, and grow our businesses through business strategy, applying spiritual laws to our businesses, and by applying social media & marketing that works! We will streamline our brand, create & edit the right products and services, learn how to price our products & services & also how to heal personal issues that stop us from having the success we dream of!

 Businesses can be home based, local, on-line, you name it. Together we will help each other create amazing websites, opt in's, email's, blog posts, services, brands & images that serve and sell! I will help you make sure your business has the right spiritual laws attached to it to insure its success! Some meetups will be free and some will have a small fee. I cannot wait to get started!

To learn more about me, check out my other meetup called : Journaling and Self-care meet up group. or check out my website at www.LauraMadrigano.com. I am a Mother, Fashion Designer, Spiritual Life & Business Coach and a Creative Entrepreneur who LOVES helping other women succeed!

He has been teaching me the Mathnavi week-by-week, translating it for me in the simplest of terms. These lessons have been the greatest lessons of my life, and I look forward to them eagerly. This group would be a place where he could teach others, too. A group of people coming together in the name of Rumi, and all the light and hope his words can offer.
results.name: Teachings of Rumi

results.description:
WELCOME:  My name is Vivinne (Kala) Williams.  I'm trained as a yoga teacher (certified in 1994,) massage therapist and in mindfulness meditation.

"Williams presents her material with assurance and grace.”   -Yoga Journal

Currently because it costs more for me-- if group is over 50, I'm limiting membership to those who really will attend- PLEASE DO JOIN- if you'd like to attend our first workshop on "Vision Board Creation & Manifestation" or the second one "Mid Winter Retreat."  A small member fee is charged to help defray expenses and to weed out folks who will not be active.

When/Where: 1x Month, in Manhattan- Midtown or Chelsea space.

Our evolving purpose: Let's come together to form Sacred Community of women 30+ who seek to empower and activate their own feminine gifts of manifestation, joy, abundance and healing while supporting peace and well-being for all (family/friends/the world.)  The goal is that you leave each workshop or gathering feeling empowered, energized and filled with self-love that makes you magnetic to your dreams & the world.

What we'll do:  Each month will be different at this point. Gather together to accomplish the above goals.  So we will learn & practice various methods:  mindfulness, meditation, chanting, journaling, affirmations, yoga focused on our goals as women- really any spiritual tool- primarily from Eastern, Yogic, Buddhist, New Age traditions. 

Once the group get's going it might be nice to alternate a class, then a tea or unstructured gathering in rotation.

OH MY ULTIMATE SECRET (SHHHHhhh) AGENDA IS: TO take a group of women to Italy for yoga, visual delights, food etc. of Venice, Tuscany.

Who might this be for: well if you are drawn then this is probably for you.  I envision women, 30+ years old, you may have a spiritual practice or you are ready to start one, but you don't need to be an expert.  You want a community of like minded women.  I'm gonna throw out some words, some opposites, it's so hard to pin down you may be:  creative/analytical, crunchy-vegan/conscious ominivore, artsy/cerebral,  high- heel wearing/Birkenstocks,  feather earrings/diamond studs.  You MOST LIKELY HAVE:  dabbled and/or are into yoga or meditation, new age or spiritual books etc.... We will get "woo-woo" but you don't have to fit into a box, or wear it on your sleeve ;-)

AND YOU WANT TO BE:

Healthier- more tuned into your body, more grounded, less frazzled, worried, tired.  Really get grounded in your feminine essence that we as busy urban woman can overlook.  Meaning- more tuned into Nature, your Intuition, your Knowingness- your Divine Feminine Wisdom.  These are capitalized as they are all vital and intertwined. 

Mentally/Emotionally: 

You def. feel the world is "off."  You can see that we are careening on many levels, disassociated from Reality, that fear, anger, greed have overrun the planet.  You know and want to be part of the POSITIVE CHANGES THAT ARE HAPPENING. 

They may be hard to see, but it's a REAFFIRMATION OF THE FEMININE- IN THE WORLD.  The values such as sharing, respect, support, strength without need to dominate etc.  These values will return overall- to men and women, but women energetically are feeling it first!

What sort of goals or aspirations do you have for the group? That the group become indispensible for members as a safe, supportive group/circle where your spiritual, feminine/yin side, grows allowing you to feel more grounded, powerful and effective in the world. And where friendships are born and like-minded real life connections happen. You become your best self that shines out to family, friend and the world.

What do you expect of the members?

To be supportive of other group members first and foremost, to be kind.  Our aim is to manifest our life dreams using spiritual techniques;  this as a balance and to energize the actions we take-- the "doing" that is already happening.

Why did you start the Meetup Group?

I used to live in Western Mass, and feel like in that area there are lots of little groups and communitys of conscious women.  As a spiritual teacher (budding) I'm wanting to create a community that I can nurture, serve and empower while providing livelihood for myself.
results.name: NYC The Yoga of Manifestation for Women

results.description:
About Theology on Tap: Have you ever noticed that sometimes your best and deepest theological reflections happen outside of your place of worship, when you are hanging out with friends? We have too, and that is the whole idea behind Theology on Tap.  Our Theology on Tap is for those who embrace the questions, rather than those who embrace answers - meaning that if you are hoping to tell everyone your "truth," but are unwilling to listen to the "truth" of others, this isn't for you.  This is for people of all faiths, all denominations within faiths, and those who are seekers.  And, as a result, it has really taken off! Past topics have included “Pluralism: How can we talk about God without killing each other?”, “Faith: What’s that all about?”, and “Why are we here?: An exploration of the meaning of our existence.” The topic in January will be “A New Year, A New Faith?: What questions and challenges do we need to explore in the year ahead, and which spiritual practices are best for you?”

For directions, go to the Fitzgerald’s website by clicking on this link: http://www.fitzgeralds1928.com/

results.description:
This workshop is for those who want to reclaim the power to live your life fully. By learning ancient Toltec techniques to master awareness, shift limiting beliefs, and change your story, you bring YOU back to life and reclaim your authenticity and happiness. 

You will learn how to integrate The 4 agreements (by don Miguel Ruiz) into every day life and learn ancient Toltec tools (recapitulation, mirroring, dreaming, intent) to recreate your dream with integrity and love. In the workshop series, we will do exercises to master each of the 4 agreements (Be Impeccable With Your Word, Don't Take Anything Personally, Don't Make Assumptions, Always Do Your Best), learn healing techniques to release fear at the cell level, and create a community of support and action moving toward creating our new dream with awareness. 

Each workshop will have a topic related to one of the agreements, exercises or games, and open time for support, a closing ceremony and homework to integrate into daily life. It will be fun, uplifting, powerful and supportive group which will meet bi-weekly. You can go to all the classes or pop in to any one, because they will each be complete in their own way and do not progress in a specific order or sequence. All the agreements are addressed over and over again from different aspects, and different exercises, tools etc are shared to help integrate each one into daily life.

results.description: Have you ever wondered what it's like to speak a language nobody else understands? Do you have your own language that you speak and want to teach others? results.description:
Entrepreneurship is an art form, responsible in part for shaping the state of human affairs. As innovators and members of a global community we should strive to better understand the nature of our thoughts and actions. Why do we defy the odds to pursue our goals? How can we transcend ego, cultivate mindfulness and calibrate our efforts to serve a greater good?

Insight awakens by calming the mind and peering inward; A daunting task for the often extroverted entrepreneur. While it may be difficult or appear as counter-productive, we can expand our awareness of self and thus begin to realize the innate wisdom that has become buried under layers of social conditioning. 

While this process may be confusing or even spiritually disruptive, it is the first step toward rejecting the “me first” mentality in favor of benevolence. Let’s explore such topics in the context of entrepreneurship through community-driven discussions, with an objective to challenge our present beliefs and redefine what it means to be a leader in modern business.
results.name: Philosophy of Social Entrepreneurship

results.description: This is the official group for ATTCK LIVE events.

results.description:
Welcome to the FAB Women!

As women, entrepreneurs, and corporate executives we *ARE* more than just business. We are "OUR" business! We want to connect like-minded individuals interested in growing themselves and their business to help each other succeed.

Here you will find an avenue of opportunity, a network of all things possible; we are a community committed to connecting, empowering and inspiring women to a "Live an Authentic life that is Happy, Healthy & Free!"

The goal of FABulous Women is to connect, empower and inspire — creating a space where women come together to share experiences, insights and resources all while having fun and making meaningful connections to build themselves and their businesses!

We run both live & online events that are energizing & inspiring - with a focus on personal growth , wellness and business.

Become a member of FABulous Women today and discover a world of new possibilities, real connections, fresh inspiration and unbelievable growth!

This Community is for you if you:

• don’t really like networking events
• if you want to get down to work quickly and forgo the chit chat
• are very busy and find it hard to find the time to meet with people after a networking event
• believe in helping others grow their business
• feel frustrated with the noise and distraction and want the tools to grow yourself and your business

Community Guidelines:

• Business cards are given upon request - not passed out like a poker hand.  :0)
• Help us know WHO you are and what you need (not only what you do) – this gathering is business building through needs discussions
• No annual membership – if you find value here, you will come back because you want to

This Community is *not* for you if you:

• are here to only solicit for clients/customers/team members
• aren’t interested in helping and referring community members
• are judgmental of others or closed-minded to unique business offerings
results.name: FABulous Women

results.description: Calling all brain hackers. Let's come together! To anyone interested in learning about, working with, and/or developing OpenBCI hardware and software, this Meetup group is for you. OpenBCI is an open-source, programable brain-computer interface, and we want to teach you how to use it, and for you to help us improve it! Join us; let's collaborate on the many challenges faced in designing more practical brain-computer interfaces. The possibilities are endless. From application dev, to software dev, to hardware improvements, to electrode design, to 3D headset modeling/printing... the list goes on and on! As our community continues to grow, so do the possibilities of what we can discover and create. What can we build together?

results.description:
This group is to provide companionship and support to you in all of your ventures and adventures. There is no need to be alone; whatever you want to do, we will do it with you. The one rule is you must in turn be just as supportive to other group members. This group is to help create real friendships and a loving communal environment. It is for people who like to communicate and share, people who like learning about and accepting differences of others. If you want to let your guard down and just live, then this group is for you. Do you have, friends that don't do the things you like to do, no friends, are you new to the area, or love making new friends...then this group is for you.

Each week a member will have the opportunity to suggest and host something she wants to do, read a book together, debate and idea, travel to a crazy place, make a video, whatever it is YOU NAME IT we will do it.  

We will support each other, learn something new, but especially learn how to work with and be supportive of one another.  Don't speak about it be about it; let's do it ladies.  There are too many people on this planet to be alone.


Hello , fellow Adventurers,
I am no longer MIA.  I have attached a video which has been uploaded to YouTube. I hope that you all can find some time to watch it; it is about 7 mins long.
After watching it please do not forget to inbox me as soon as possible with a day you would prefer to meet...Fri, or Sat.
 
I look forward to us meeting and making great use of this group. I apologize for my absence as there were some unforeseen events that took precedence.
I guess we need to make up for lost time!! LOL
This is a link to the Youtube video I would like you to watch:
https://youtu.be/QD5nEdFOLPU
And please answer the poll question. Thank you.

topics.name: How to Market Your Business through Blogging

results.description:
Why Join The Blogger Babes Meetup group? 

It can get lonely for anyone trying to blog her way to the top. That’s why we formed The Blogger Babes. It’s not just an  association –  it’s more like a sisterhood. We help each other out, from sharing useful tips  to collaborating with members to create awesome content together.

You’ll benefit from our experienced bloggers - those that have been blogging for quite a while and who actually make a living from their blog - to our handy tips and tools , networking opportunities and the educational webinars we coordinate at least twice a month.

We offer some pretty exciting (and exclusive) stuff:

· Socializing and Networking Opportunities: Hang out with your fellow bloggers, both in person and virtually! We organize parties, meetups and webinars for our Blogger Babes. 

· Exclusive Content: Hone your skills, cultivate new ideas and pick up a few tips with our content – ebooks, articles, webinars and more! Only available to Blogger Babes members.

·Support: The Blogger Babes are a friendly bunch – and we encourage members to reach out to one another, to make friends, collaborate, give encouragement and seek advice from members. You can’t do everything by yourself, and you shouldn’t have to when your fellow blogger babes are such excellent sources of support.

Goodies & Gifts & Sponsored Opportunities: We're continuously working to find sponsors for our bloggers. It's a win-win situation for both parties - our sponsors get exposure and feedback about their products & services, and our bloggers get to try out new products and services for free . This also gives a chance for our newer bloggers to learn how to review products the right way ( yes, there is a right and wrong way to write spectacular product reviews that will keep your sponsors coming back and your readers clamoring for more..).

Does this all sound exciting? Come join us and start blogging better now, and do tell all the other bloggers  in your life to join the Blogger Babes movement.

PS:Make sure you subscribe to our no-cost newsletter at www.bloggerbabes.com to get all of this week’s valuable content in condensed form.
results.name: Blogger Babes NYC + Tristate

results.description:

This group is for both existing host and new host family who want to join the club and host students. It's for host who want to be part of a group sharing ideas, stories, tips, and even time together to help make each hosting experience an interesting one. 

I started this group because hosting for 15 years, I live a homestay lifestyle. Everything I do revolves around hosting directly and indirectly. There are many other host families in NYC who are doing the same thing but on their own. As a group we can meet for dinner, share stories and advice. Once a year we may even group together and go on an overseas vacation! An urban homestay lifestyle in NYC is positively unique.

results.description: Welcome to the 28on27 | 1315 Photography studio and event space meet up group! Here you will find invitations to photography and special events we are throwing, participating in or curating. We will also be hosting regular meetups on Photography, Retouching, and Career Development!
results.name: 28on27 | 1315 Photography Studio and Event Space

results.description:
Central NJ Strategic Design + Tech

Driven to ensure New Jersey is a viable state to start and develop businesses, we are gathering creative technologists to discuss our thriving ecosystem of innovators, educators, engineers, entrepreneurs, policy makers, and the capital community.

Mission

The mission of this group is to support and aid people from all markets and technology areas. Our hope is to help people accelerate the process, and reduce the risk of moving from concept, into production and releasing to the public market. We want to help educate on new ways of designing, prototyping, building and fulfilling tech hardware, software, systems, & components.


We will be focused on many different topics during MeetUps:

• Startups, Entrepreneurialism, and Growing Business in NJ

• Civic Engagement and Gov’t Policy

• Workforce Diversity

• Education & Technology (EdTech, 21st Ed)

• Capitalization and Fundraising (VC, angels, crowdfunding)

• Strategic Design & Sustainable Business Models

• Disruption and Innovation

• User Experience (UX)

• Manufacturing

• Hardware and Software Engineering

• Maker movement

• Emergent Technology

• Mobile development

• Internet of Things and Wearables

• Big Data, Machine Learning, Predictive Analytics

• BioTech

• FinTech

• User Interface Design & Information Architecture

• Marketing and Business Networking


All meetup discussions will be supplemented with time for hands-on learning workshops. This is a group formed exists to support the startup community .

• Presentations

• Demo Nights

• Hackathons

• Coworking

• Startup Weekends

• Networks

• Show and Tell


Necessary Stakeholders in the EcoSystem - If this is you, come on out:

• Coworking spots

• Developers

• Entrepreneurs

• Designers

• Capital Community

• Educational professionals

• Government leaders


To be clear, we're looking to collaborate with the many other MeetUps in the area and welcome interaction so don't overlap too much and conflict. If you're organizing another MeetUp in this domain, this is another venue for you to network and present your ideas – we welcome the collaboration and conversation with kindred spirits.
results.name: NJ Strategic Design + Tech

results.description: Young contemporary art collectors between the ages of 21-40 are invited to join this group. We will go on a walking tour of select Chelsea openings. We will expand our meetup to galleries in Bushwick and the LES in Spring/Summer 2015. This group aims to guide and educate young collectors as they venture into building their own collections.
results.name: Young Art Collectors NYC

results.description: Originally from bonny Scotland? Missing the patter and banter and being able to be completely understood :-) ? Join the clan!
results.name: New York Scottish Expats

results.description:
This is a group to bring together those of African descent who are currently devotees of African spirituality, and those who are interested in learning more about it. It is about us sharing how to honor our ancestors, referring each other to gifted spiritual workers, and learning more about indigenous African spiritual traditions.

I, Seshat, offer readings, communing with the ancestors.  When you sign up, be sure to let us know of any gifts and talents you wish to share.
results.name: Traditional African Spirituality Meetup

results.description: Deva's, Goddesses, Sisters and Queens Come meet up with other Goddesses on the path to transformation and manifestation. Enlightenment through soul centered self-nurturing and connection! Use this Sister Circle to connect with sisters who desire to shake the shackles of fear by joining other women, who have decided that this is the year of abundance, freedom, manifestation and realization! We will meet for great conversations, wine tasting, book club, Deva's nights, dinner and anything else we so choose.
results.name: Urban Soul Deva's  Meetup

topics.name: Tarot Readings Astrology Numerology and Classes

results.description: This is a group for people who would like to learn about many metaphysical topics including tarot, astrology, Feng Shui, meditation, angels, pendulums and many other topics. It is for someone who has an interest in expanding their mind to all of the possibilities our vast universe has to offer.
results.name: Butler Metaphysics Meetup

results.description:
SAY HELLO TO YOUR NEW FRIENDS.

Our mission is to bring adventure and fun into your life while building lifelong friendships. As Eleanor Roosevelt once said, “the purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” And, that’s exactly what Welcome to Queens is all about! We are a fun group of young professionals with varied interests who are looking to get out, foster new friendships, and enjoy life.

We are a group of young professionals 21-39 looking to explore Queens.

Are you tired of sitting at home? Is it hard to get together with friends who are married or have moved away? Is the weekly bar scene getting boring and old to you? Well you are not alone! Modern day society has caused people to feel completely frazzled and out of sync with nature and enjoying what life has to offer. Get ready to dust off that bucket list and start living life to the fullest!

We pride ourselves in creating and organizing exciting and unique experiences. Have you ever thought what it might be like to be a trapeze circus performer? What about the exciting pastime of exploring wild caves – Spelunking? Or maybe, you’re into some indoor fun such as Dodgeball, Laser Tag, and Slam Dunk Basketball.

Our activities include everything from dinner and drinks and fun nightlife activities, to ski and camping weekend getaways, and everything in between. Do you want to ignite your summer with sky diving, parasailing, fun BBQ’s, and participating in sports activities such as Volleyball and Kickball? Do you have life goals such as running in a Spartan or Survival race? If you are looking to get off of the couch, meet new people, and have a blast, then Welcome to Queens is the group for you.
results.name: Welcome to Queens 21-39

results.description:
Do you love Jamaica Bay? Lend your voice and make a difference!

Join the National Parks Conservation Association and the Jamaica Bay Advocates to stay connected to all things happening in Jamaica Bay. Learn about upcoming events, find job postings, and be the voice of the bay!

Explore your waters. Defend your park. Find your voice.
results.name: Jamaica Bay Advocates

results.description:
The world is #drivenbydata and we aim to empower the masses by sharing knowledge and expertise on all things Data.

We will discuss real data challenges and how to overcome them with the latest BI and data management tools. We will demo new products, present how-tos and best practices, and hold hands on training sessions on BI and Data Science topics.

We hold regular sessions every second Tuesday of the month, and additional sessions for training days or other tech events.
results.name: Tech Tuesday

results.description:
A Billion Entrepreneurs Foundation, Inc. presents: New York Business Meetup Workshop Series

The workshops are based on the successful Business Finishing School curriculum that focuses on the 12 Foundation Principles of Business.

Business Finishing School (“BFS”) is a leading business-growth education company that teaches “next-level” business principles; which are beyond the usual marketing, accounting, and management concepts.

Are you operating at your best inside your business?

Is the business you own (or work for) fully on purpose and hitting all of its objectives?

BFS believes that all businesses should sit firmly on top of the 12 Foundational Principles of Business, in order to maximize potential and growth. BFS has created a blueprint that virtually any motivated entrepreneur, executive, or employee can implement. This blueprint will add systemization and predictability to your growth and profit. By adopting these 12 principles, your organization will increase the probability of long-term success, while leveraging the talents and experience of all involved.

The Business Finishing School team will walk through the steps of a better framework for business and personal success; using an approach which builds on purpose-driven behavior. These events can be used to refocus your business or to plan a new venture the right way from the start. These meetups are a great way to learn about other local resources for entrepreneurs and connect with others who share the same passion for success.
results.name: New York Business Meetup

results.description:
This group is for those who are looking to embrace who they truly are by becoming more consciously aware . We offer workshops and meditations that promote healing along with self-discovery. Our goal is provide you with individual or group focused life force energy healing by teaching exploratory workshops specializing in the healing arts that will allow you to create a life you love to live. We believe in helping others know and appreciate negative emotion so they could lead more peaceful lives and achieve happiness. "The time has come to stop trying to feel better and instead become better at feeling" ~ Teal Swan

Visit us at www.lovehealinglifecenter.com!
results.name: Love Yourself NJ ~ Spiritual Healing Workshops

topics.name: Learning About Wines Around the World

results.description:
Do you like wine? Not sure which wine to get at the restaurant or store? Want to learn more about wine? Enjoy meeting people over wine?  

Join us and become a WineO. Let's get to know more about wine in a comfortable, fun, and interactive setting. We believe in a smaller group setting so that us WineOs can have a more personable and friendly experience.

Types of events we will host:

• Wine 101 Get Togethers (fun and educational)

• Wine events
results.name: WineO 101 Get Togethers/Events

results.description: This is a group for entrepreneurs, engineers, futurists, and innovators who want to learn about the most promising new technology and generate enormous wealth from the opportunities it holds. Technological innovation is advancing at a faster pace than ever before, so this group is designed to help you keep all of it straight and aware of opportunities to get involved. Meetups will involve a range of speakers, technology demonstrations, panel discussions, networking, and more.
results.name: XPRIZE Think Tank NYC

results.description: This is a group for young women living in or near Bergen County who are interested in making new friends, reading exciting books, and drinking delicious wine! As an avid reader and wine drinker, I wanted to get together with a group of women (around 10-15) once a month at a wine bar or restaurant in Bergen County where we can discuss that month's book and enjoy a good meal--or at least a glass of wine (or any other beverage of your choosing). With the exception of the inaugural meeting, the next book to read will be decided by the group at the end of each meeting. For more info, please feel free to contact me here on Meetup!
results.name: Young Women's Wine and Book Club - Bergen County

results.description: What will building be like in the future? When will we see robots on construction sites? Join if you're interested in construction robotics, construction 3d printing, smart materials, and internet of things. We'll meet to discuss cutting edge research & experiments, and new ventures.
results.name: Construction Robotics NYC

results.description: We meet up to play bluegrass music. I perform, record, and teach bluegrass music professionally. I teach mandolin and guitar and have also taught bluegrass jammin at many festivals and privately. I recently have moved from my homestate of Virginia to Hastings on Hudson, NY and have made a few musician friends, done a few gigs and have been teaching some students and have been hearing from many sides that folks might be interested in getting a regular or semi-regular, or even occasional good bluegrass jam in the area that folks can go to, so here I am starting one if there is enough interest.
results.name: Westchester County Bluegrass jam

results.description: Join a warm community teaching you a fresh approach to Holistic Healing. Improve your health, wellness and personal growth with groups, classes and workshops. We use various styles and traditions to create a practice that is natural, effective and enjoyable for people of all experience levels and lifestyles.
results.name: Vibra Lounge

results.description: Being single in New York City, I thought it would be great to start a walking group.  The purpose of this group is to take something you love to do (walking) and make it possible for others (45-55) to come out and enjoy a nice walk in this wonderful city we live in and at the same time meet new people: ).  Walks will usually take place near Central Park.  In the Spring when the weather starts getting warmer, will plan walks along the Hudson and around Manhattan as well.  For those who would like to socialize after the walk (ie: bite to eat - that can be planned too)! Group is new as of mid-January 2015, so just feeling things out.  Suggestions welcome.

results.description: #UnconventionalMarketing is a group where we'll unearth some of the most interesting, innovative and off-the-wall branding methods happening today. We can complain about today's consumer all we want, or we can put our heads together to create some cool and actionable campaign ideas.
