topics.name: Sport Bikes, Street Bikes, Motorcycle Meetups
Sharing a Love of Motorcycle Riding

results.description:
Ministry of CMA

Vision:  Changing the world, one heart at a time.

We will accomplish our vision through:

Evangelistic outreach primarily, but not exclusively, to the motorcycling community.  Run for the Son, where we will partner with ministries with world-reaching potential.  Equipping our members in ministry training that aligns itself with Biblical truths.  A servant's attitude to the world and to our members (i.e. Here if you need us).  Quality products that aid in evangelistic outreach.  An effective WorkCenter support team.

CMA Ministry Partners:
CMA partners with three other ministries (Jesus Film Project, Missionary Ventures, and Open Doors) to spread the Gospel around the world. In 2013 CMA donated $788,070.90 to each one of the three ministries as a result of the Run for the Son fundraiser.

Mission:
To inspire our leaders and members to be the most organized, advanced, equipped, financially stable organization, full of integrity in the motorcycling industry and the Kingdom of God.

Doctrinal Statement:
The Christian Motorcyclists Association is interdenominational and evangelistic in nature.

We believe in:

• The Bible as the inspired and infallible Word of God.

• One God, eternally existent in three persons: Father, Son and Holy Spirit.

• The virgin birth and deity of Christ, His explicit atoning death, bodily resurrection and ascension.

• Salvation through the blood of Jesus Christ.

• The sanctifying power of the Holy Spirit who enables a believer to live holy.

• The second coming of Jesus Christ.


For information on becoming an official member of CMA please visit this link below:

http://www.cmausa.org/ministry/membership-requirements.asp
results.name: Christian Motorcyclists Association NYC Chapter

results.description:
This Group is for Woman who suffer from Mood Disorders ages 21+ only.

What we are About: Our group is to reach out to woman in the New York area who suffer from Mood Disorders "diagnosed or not" for support and friendship. This group will bond woman of ages 21+ who can relate and understand one another through the voices of honest experiences-past and present as well as develop new long term friendships with exciting group activities.

Please visit our facebook page: <br>Www.facebook.com/strongwomenwithmd

Visit our blog page: <br>Strongwomenwithmd.wordpress.com

Visit our Twitter page: <br>Strong Women with MD

Visit our Instagram: <br>STRONG_WOMEN_W_MD

Our email is: <br>Strongwomenwithmd@gmail.com

Our Goal:  To help women just like us with mood disorders... Have you ever had a day where you could not get out of bed, a day where you lied to get out of a date that was planned, a night/week you could not sleep, a day where you could not eat or ate too much, a day you could not pay your bills, a day you realized you were the reason for losing your jobs, a day where no one understood you, a day you felt all alone, or even a day where you felt as if you wanted to die? That STOPS NOW!

Our hope for this group is to be there for one another through these times with support and no judgement. Our group is to build bonds with honesty that will lead to communication, trust and hopefully long term friendships that will result in fun activities.

This group will have bi-weekly meet ups for group discussion about our lives and at the end of each meet up we all will decide what we want our end of the month (or more) activity to be.

Group Commitment: This group will require you to be 100% honest in commitment to yourself and all of us when joining. We will ask you to read, post and share in our blog which will help inspire yourself and others. This blog will be about us, gratification and our success in friendship.  

strongwomenwithmd.wordpress.com 

RSVP & Attendee Policy: You should be able to attend at least one event per month. Anyone who has not attended an event within the first few months of joining will be removed. as the goal is to be an active member. If you RSVP yes, please do not cancel the day of the event. If you need to cancel, please do so within 48 hours of the event. No shows will not be tolerated and can lead to removal from the group. Changing your RSVP on the day of the event without notifiction is just as bad as not showing up. We take the time to make reservations and hold spot for you. Please keep the event host informed. 

Please understand and thank you.

Please keep in mind we are not licensed doctors or therapists. We are just like you. This group consists of woman sharing their stories and are here to listen and support only.

We look forward to meeting you,

Megan and Vanessa

A STRONG WOMAN is one who feels deeply and loves fiercely. Her tears flow just as abundantly as her laughter. A STRONG WOMAN is both soft and powerful. She is both practical and spiritual. A STRONG WOMAN in her essence is a GIFT to the world!
results.name: Friendship & Support Group For Women With Mood Disorders

results.description:
IdeaCon is a bi-monthly event on focused on Big Ideas in Content Marketing and Content. 

If you're looking to get a pulse on Content Marketing Trends in 2015, and hear thought leaders speak on timely first-hand case studies, join the group and stay tuned.  We usually announce the location two weeks prior, and sign-ups will be limited so stay tuned!

Our panel format generally includes three people from the following types of industries: 

a.) a brand or agency content marketer

b.) a creative, artist, or content maker

c.) a publisher

We start the panel with a challenge that each one is facing and end with an interactive Q&A and the requisite time for drinks and mingling. 

 You’ll be at home in this group if you are:   

 a.) a brand, startup, or individual engaged in storytelling and trying to find an audience.  

b.) a writer, photographer, or multi-media artist looking to build new audience.  

c.) a technologist interested in content creation, delivery, or optimization.
results.name: IdeaCon:  Content Marketing Meetup Group of New York

topics.name: Make New Friends, from all Walks of Life

results.description:
hello!  i have just repatriated from living 20 years in asia and am trying to get together a group of ex-pats, re-pats & like minded folk with diverse and varied interests.  although many groups already exist, they are for a younger crowd with age caps.  i'm hoping to meet 45+ year olds who are also interested in meeting new people and partaking in different activities at group members' suggestions, e.g.: visiting museums, attending performances/film, sports, and (naturally) sharing our travel adventures (the good, the bad & the ugly!), and the (re) discovery of nyc -  and anything else piques members' interest.

i hope the members would get to know each other well and actually establish new friendships.  who knows, we could have:  potluck dinners, movie nights, craft nights etc. at member/friends' homes. sound good?  hope to meet you!
results.name: Expats, Repats & New to NYC (45+ years)

Join us for wine, cheese and lots of fun with women who are getting smart with their money.

So, whether you are a Business Analyst/ Data Analyst or a Project Manager perhaps working for a Finance change initiative within the Regulatory landscape or for a wealth management division, lets come together and create and diversify opportunities to excel and go up the ladder in our respective careers. results.description:
Established in the Fall 2013, Queensboro Tri Inc. is a Type B Not-For-Profit organization and a registered USA Triathlon club providing beginner and intermediate level endurance athletes living in Queens and the surrounding areas a way to train for a multisport event(s) in a team environment. Our goal is to help our community of athletes embrace the multi-sport lifestyle in a fun, supportive and social environment. Each year we will be participating in various triathlons, swimming, biking, and running races in the Metropolitan area and beyond. We welcome all levels!

Although we have yearly membership dues, we invite you to join us in a couple training sessions to see if we can help you in reaching your multisport goals! Sign up for one and meet the team!

Visit our homepage at: www.queensborotri.org
results.name: Queensboro Tri Club

results.description: We invite you to join, sing and meet members of the Connecticut and New York area community by singing with The Stamford Chorale. All are welcome. Auditions are not required. Our musical abilities range from beginner to professional. The Chorale performs a Winter and Spring concert. We also perform various outreach programs during the year. The Stamford Chorale will begin rehearsals for our fall season on Tuesday, September 8, 2015. Practice is held Tuesdays from 7:30 p.m. to 9:30p.m. at The Atria Stamford, 77 3rd Street, Stamford, 06905. Sign-ups still possible once the rehearsal season has begun! Whether you have prior singing experience or just love to sing.... you might enjoy the challenge and the pleasure of learning new music with men and women of all ages who just love to sing... come join us! New singers are welcomed and encouraged. The Chorale has been in existence since 1941. The Chorale's repertoire is varied. They just presented an All-Mozart program for the winter concert in December 2015. This spring they are tackling an All-American folksong program. Looking forward to seeing you!
results.name: The Stamford Chorale

results.description: D. THOMAS FINE MINIATURES IS HOSTING A MONTHLY MEET UP FOR ADULT MINIATURE ENTHUSIASTS, CURIOSITY-SEEKERS, HOBBYISTS, STUDENTS AND COLLECTORS AT ALL LEVELS...WE'LL DISCUSS HAPPENINGS IN THE MINIATURES WORLD, PLAN OUTINGS AND COLLABORATE ON PROJECTS RELATED TO FINE SCALE MINIATURES.
results.name: MINIATURES MEET UP

results.description:
“Top of the Morning To You!” - an unusual Sabbath service!

What if you got together with friends, shared some intimate moments, munched great food and “talked meaningful stuff” ?!?

That’s what we are doing.
On a Saturday morning.
We won’t sit in the pews. We won’t call out page numbers.
We will look at some lines of psalms. Talk about our own lives.
Snack on waffles, orange juice,  nibble nuts and babka.
Sit at the table and hear a story. And make meaning out of  
life, modern and ancient.

it will be a shorter service….10:30am-11:45am  (and followed by kugel and Kiddush)

Be part of a grand experiment. Be part of a meaningful get together.
Bring the inner munchies - your soul’s and your tummy’s - home for  morning

Rabbi Biller brings his warm, open, accessible style
to facilitating this get-together

Congregation Beth Ahm.  56 Grove Avenue, Verona NJ . Sat. Feb. 7th -   10:30am-11:45am
Not for just-experienced or just-novice service goers. For people.
For More information, call our office at 973-239-0754. Mon., Tues., Wed. & Friday 9am-1pm.
results.name: Top o'the Morning: An Unusual Shabbat Service

results.description:
So you 're in your 20s. You have plenty of ideas in your head you want to share! You want to make some new friends. Or maybe your friends are boring and uninteresting and you're a little tired of staying home every day, all day. So you decided to join a laid back welcoming group! You happen to have an interest in trying different activities every now and then. You might like dinning out, talking about random topics important to you, watching a nice movie and maybe talking about it afterwards, playing dominos, pool, going to a comedy club, playing recreational sports like dodgeball or ultimate frisbee, live drawing, hiking, camping, singing, HAVING FUN! This is what this group is about. If you like the way it sounds, help me build it into an amazing group! What are you waiting for join!


*This group is not a place to sale your products, bash anyones opinion, club every friday, do drugs, binge drink, or kill anyones vibes*
results.name: Hangouts (in their 20s)

results.description:
As a business owner or entrepreneur, are you serious about using networking to grow your business?

Networking matters whether you want new customers, repeat business, referrals or attention of potential investors. However, it is seldom taught anywhere and consequently most networkers fail to get adequate return out of their investment in business networking meetings.


Business networking is not about exchanging cards!

There are tools such as elevator pitches, one-on-ones, strategic alliances, follow ups and social media that you need to master. Whether you are a pro or a newbie, our tools help you tremendously in honing your business networking skills. Our events are quality events that help you grow into a power networker who gets real business out of networking meetings. We also strive to create a synergistic referral network for you.

At our events you can:

• Mingle with like minded individuals and create strong business relationships.

• Reach everyone in the meetup through elevator pitches.

• Take part in our highly successful interactive educational programs.

• Learn more about the mindset and skills of business ownership.

• Learn about and create strategic alliances.

• Become a spotlight speaker and promote your business.

About myself: I have been organizing one of the highest ranked NY Connect and Grow business networking group on meetup with 4200+ members and felt a need of a networking group which teaches people how to network. Looking forward to meet you at our next event!
results.name: New York Business Networking For Results

results.description:
*Welcome to New York Entrepreneur Mastermind. The concept of the "mastermind alliance" was formally introduced by Napoleon Hill in his timeless classic, "Think And Grow Rich," though mastermind groups have been around since the beginning of time. The purpose of the group is to support and hold each other accountable to our personal and professional goals. For more about Mastermind go here: 

http://www.thesuccessalliance.com/what-is-a-mastermind-group.html

Napoleon Hill wrote about the mastermind group principle as: "The coordination of knowledge and effort of two or more people, who work toward a definite purpose, in the spirit of harmony." He continues…"No two minds ever come together without thereby creating a third, invisible intangible force, which may be likened to a third mind [the master mind]."

Whether you are just starting out in the world of business or you have done this one thousand time. This mastermind is a place to get

 feedback, help you brainstorm new possibilities, and set up accountability structures that keep you focused and on track. You create a community of supportive colleagues who brainstorm together to move the members to new heights.


You'll gain tremendous insights which improve your business and personal life. Your mastermind group is like having a objective board of directors, a success team, and a peer advisory group, all rolled into one.
results.name: New York Entrepreneurs Mastermind

topics.name: Young Women Affected by Breast Cancer

results.description:
We Race Because… 
•One in eight women in the U.S. will be diagnosed with breast cancer in her lifetime. 
•Because every minute, somewhere in the world, someone dies from breast cancer. 
•And because, breast cancer knows no boundaries- be it age, gender, socio-economic status or geographic location. 
•We continue to Race because at the current rate, 13 million breast cancer deaths around the world will occur in the next 25 years. 

But, when you participate and fundraise for the Race, we fight these statistics together. In 1980, the 5-year relative survival rate for women diagnosed with early stage breast cancer (cancer confined to the breast) was about 74 percent. Today, that number is 99 percent! Komen has played a critical role in every major advance in the fight against breast cancer - transforming how the world talks about and treats this disease and helping to turn millions of breast cancer patients into breast cancer survivors. This progress was made with your continued support and together we can reach our vision of a world without breast cancer.
results.name: Susan G. Komen North Jersey Race For the Cure Meetups

results.description:
"Food is more than survival. With it we make friends, court lovers, and count our blessings." - Nat Geo 

This group is intended to bring together food lovers primarily in their 20s and early 30s. The goal is to make new friends, enjoy delicious food, and learn about different cultures. If you have a particular cuisine or restaurant you would like to try, feel free to let us know. We are always looking for cultural ambassadors who can show us their foods. 

DETAILS: We will have both small and large group dinners. 

• Small group (4-6 people) 

• Large group (6-12 people) 

In addition to dinners, to keep things interesting, we will host other events: 

• Coffee/Tea Meetups

• Food Crawls (sampling of food from different restaurants that are within walking distance) 

• Happy Hours/Bar Meetups 

• Karaoke 

• Sports 

• Picnics 

• Comedy Clubs 

• Shows 

• Game Night

RULES: 

1) FEES: We don’t believe in charging people to make friends. However, we also know that inconsiderate RSVPs spoil the experience for everyone. For most events we will charge a $1 maintenance fee, this is not to make money.  The money goes toward the group and covers the monthly website fee.  

2) ATTENDANCE: Most events will be first come first serve. If you RSVP and cannot go, please provide notice a day in advance. Of course, we understand there are emergencies, but please do let us know. 

3) RSVP policy: If you RSVP and cancel the day before the meetup, please send the organizer(s) a message to notify them. If you fail to do so or RSVP and do not show up, you will be temporarily suspended from the next meetup. If you RSVP and do not show up on occasion depending on the circumstances you may be either suspended from the group for a longer period of time, or removed from the group. Though this may sound harsh, please understand that the organizers put time and effort into planning these meetups. More importantly, this gives others a chance to attend our events. 

4) Profile pictures: Please have a clear photo of yourself when you join. We know you're not actually the NY skyline or a cartoon character.  :)

Thank you and we look forward to meeting you all!
results.name: NYC Young Food Lovers

results.description:
Tired of going to MeetUp events and trying to act cool at some random hipster bar? Well, act cool no more, my friends! If you are queer and not afraid to let your inner dork hang out, this group is for you.  We meet pretty regularly at a fun bar in Chelsea to play Cards Against Humanity, Head's Up, Jenga, and other games. Other potential activities include theater, stand-up comedy events, trivia, dinners and cocktail hours, movie night, karaoke, etc.   We're a pretty diverse and welcoming group, more interested in just having FUN and relaxing, rather than "networking."  You can also follow our Facebook page (search for Gay/Lesbian Nerds in the City).

To maintain the original intention of the group, please respect a few ground rules: (1) If you want to join the group, please include an actual picture of yourself in your profile and answer the group questions.  The point of a photo isn't to judge your hairdo or fashion choices, but to help the group recognize you at events.  The point of the questions is to get to know you a little bit.   (2) Please keep your RSVPs updated.  If your plans change and you can't make it, let us know.  If you have a habit of RSVPing and flaking with less than 24 notice, you may be dropped from the group.  This keeps it fair when we have limited spots to events.

results.description:
The purpose of the Young Adult Initiative is to partner with a variety of organizations to plan social activities that connect young adults with and without disabilities together. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. So its pretty much open to anyone!! 

Each event will start off with a variety of team building activities. This will provide an opportunity for our members to work together in a group setting to solve a problem or accomplish a task. We will have facilitators to help young adults with autism and social disorders interact with everyone else and to ensure that they are participating in the team building activities. Anyone can be a facilitator and we are looking for people are interested!!

After our team building activities we will have an interactive social activity to build on the relationships and capitalize on the confidence that our members developed during the team building activities. Many members of our group may be intimidated by social events that are unstructured and don’t involve an activity. We believe that individuals, in particular those who have social disorders are more likely to interact with others when they are involved in an activity that they enjoy and are good at. We therefore intend on including a wide variety of activities so there is something for everyone to enjoy. 


Some of our activities and team builders may include:

• Capture the flag 

• Team BBQ/Cookoff 

• Organizing a scavenger or treasure hunt 

• Creating a superbowl commercial or short film 

• Creating our own board game 

• Organizing a themed dance party

• Bowling 

• Egg Drop

• Amoeba Tag 

• Theatre Improv Games


We will have a planning committee that is open to all of our members that want to be more involved. The planning committee will determine and plan the specific events that we will hold, help us with fundraising, networking and marketing. Once we receive adequate funding we will make all events free of charge and provide free transportation.

results.description:
Kizomba/Semba Classes & Events by David Campos & Guida Rei in NEWARK, NEW JERSEY AREA

☞ What is Kizomba – The Origin

Kizomba is a breath whose rhythm is a beating heart, and where the perfect connection between two dancers gives birth to harmony, exaltation of senses and sensuality" D. Campos

Kizomba (a word meaning "Party" in angola ) takes its origin from the Angolan dance Semba, which is also the origin of the Brazilian Samba.

It appeared at the end of 70’s – 80’s, while the young Angolans, although very attached to their traditional dance,sought a new musical identity, and finally found their inspiration and new voice at a concert given by Kassav, a famous French Caribbean Zouk band. Kizomba was born out of this new generation’s desire to bring a touch of sensuality and sweetness to their national Semba.

The influence of the Angolan Kizomba soon spread to all the African Lusophone countries such as Guinea Bisau, Cape Verde, Mozambique. From there the dance quickly found its ticket to Europe via Portugal, where it further developed, by all these Artists, teachers, choregraphers coming from
these Luso-African countries.

As it rapidly gained popularity, Portugal exported Kizomba to various countries in Europe such as France, Spain, Poland, Belgium, Danemark and England. Today it is rare to find a Latin dance party without Kizomba represented, as well as salsa or bachata.

This "African Tango Zouk", also called "Tango Lusophone" continues to conquer a growing audience of passionate dancers, eager for beauty of gesture and sensuality, but also the indispensable complexity of exchange and trust present in each motions of Kizomba.

This young dance of barely thirty years is booming today, and constantly evolving.

"Kizomba is a tribute to sensuality, an ode to love and sharing. A moment when the woman's beauty, enhanced by her partner, must embody all its essence. " D. Campos

Be the pioneers here in the U.S. of a dance that will become soon a must for your dancing nightlife !!!
results.name: kizomba/semba - Newark, New Jersey

results.description:
In the US, 30% of all hospital births end up in cesarian section. For the rest of the developed world, that number is 7%. Unfortunately, the reason for this difference is primarily due to the profit motives and time constraints that drive the medical industrial complex. Often, when "mothers to be" enter hospitals to deliver, they are unaware of their options and put blind faith in the hands of the medical system. This can result in mothers being lead down a path that may not be in their best interest. We intend to educate, empower, and inform "mothers to be" on their options for giving birth, with a focus on natural childbirth. This includes water births, at home births, midwife and doula assisted births, hospital and birthing center births etc.


please Contact Ancient Song Doula services for services and classes for expectant moms in Brooklyn, they are pretty Awesome. I no longer live in NY and I am not organizing this group right now.

topics.name: A Course in Miracles Study Group

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Group Tuesdays from 7:00 to 8:30 PM The serene and peaceful waterside setting of Wainwright House provides a wonderful environment to study the Course. A Course in Miracles is a complete self-study spiritual thought system based on universal spiritual themes. Our group meets to read and discuss the principles that make up the Daily Lessons, the Text, and the Manual for Teachers. For the purpose of shared reading, we recommend that members bring the book titled, A Course in Miracles, Published by the Foundation for Inner Peace, Combined Volume.

 The Course does not aim at teaching the meaning of love, for that is beyond what can be taught. It does aim, however, at removing the blocks to the awareness of love's presence, which is your natural inheritance. This course can therefore be summed up very simply in this way: Nothing real can be threatened. Nothing unreal exists. Herein lies the peace of God.

 All are welcome to join us in this gentle and relaxed setting of learners.$5 donation for room. For more information, please contact acimgroup@yahoo.com Wainwright House is located at 260 Stuyvesant Ave, Rye NY (914)967-6080
results.name: A Course in Miracles at Wainwright House, Rye NY
results.who: Students of A Course in Miracles

results.description:
IN THE GAME BUSINESS NETWORKING allows you to grow your business at SPORTS EVENTS at a fraction of what companies spend to take clients to the game!

The "Three E's" of corporate entertainment: Effective, Enjoyable, and (last but not least)... EXPENSIVE. Companies spend thousands of dollars to help grow their businesses by taking clients to sporting events. While these types of interactions can have immense benefits for all involved, they come at a very steep price.

Luckily, there's IN THE GAME BUSINESS NETWORKING, which provides access to full-service networking and corporate entertainment for LESS than it costs just to buy a ticket to the game!.

A typical In The Game evening involves:

- 90 minutes high-level networking before a game at a location convenient to the arena or stadium, where you'll make business connections that are sure to payoff; drinks and hors d'oeuvres included.

- A ticket to the game in an attractive seat location.

- Access to the upscale amenities in the venue, such as private clubs and luxury suites, where you'll have the chance for further networking.

- Door prizes and other promotions offered throughout the evening.

For anyone who values the opportunity to grow their business amongst dozens of like-minded business people, in a truly unique and exciting way, then IN THE GAME BUSINESS NETWORKING is an ideal fit!
results.name: In The Game Business Networking

results.description:
Are you thinking about jumping into the hottest real estate market?  Our home buyer workshops will cover key questions prospective homebuyers should ask as they prepare to make the largest financial purchase of their lives. We outline the steps to buying a home in New York City and provide practical and informative advice from industry insiders and veterans. 
 
Topics covered in our workshops include:
* How much money do I need to buy a home in NYC?
* Mortgage payment versus rent - similarities/differences; pros/cons
* Bank criteria for loan applicants
* Down payment assistance (for eligible purchasers)
* What does a [real estate agent/ real estate attorney/ mortgage banker] do for me?  
* Insider knowledge on how to pick the best agent/ attorney and mortgage professional
* Pros and cons of purchasing different types of homes
* Condominiums vs Cooperatives; the differences, formation, governance, common charges etc.
* An overview of terminology  homebuyers will hear during the home buying process
* Post Closing-after you own, what to be careful with once you own the home including rental collection, being a landlord, maintenance

You can't afford not to attend our meet-ups!!!!
results.name: Insider Tips for New York Real Estate Home Buyers

results.description: The Universal Negro Improvement Association & African Communities’ League is a social, friendly, humanitarian, charitable, educational, institutional, constructive, spiritually governing ruling body, and is founded by persons, desiring to the utmost, to work for the general uplift of the Negro peoples of the world. And the members pledge themselves to do all in their power to conserve the rights of their noble race and to respect the rights of all mankind, believing always in the Brotherhood of Man and the Fatherhood of God. MISSION STATEMENT The Universal Negro Improvement Association and African Communities League is a provisional government lead by a spiritual ruling governing body that is established for the purpose of the general uplift of the Black race. In keeping with this purpose our goals involve activities aimed at relieving the sufferings of the Black race and include the following: - Education and Training - Nutrition and Healthcare - Housing - Arts and Humanities - Agronomy and Applied Sciences - Building and Trades - Manufacturing - Economic Development The motto of the organization is: “One God! One Aim! One Destiny!” Therefore, let justice be done to all mankind, realizing that if the strong oppresses the weak confusion and discontent will ever mark the path of man, but with love, faith and charity towards all the reign of peace and plenty will be herded into the world and the generations of men shall be called blessed.
results.name: UNIA-ACL Division 432 Queens

results.description:
Love to sing? Let's do it A Cappella! This group, led by a cappella guru Ed Cohn, will be in the Circle Singing format developed by legendary vocalist Bobby McFerrin and his disciples.

Circle Singing is a guided improvisational group singing endeavor. Facilitator Ed Cohn will improvise parts on the spot to be be sung by the group. The result is instant gratification of harmony and rhythm and the magic it creates. There are no lyrics to learn, but rather simple syllables that shape the sound. Ed will lead a number of various singing "games" that each focus on different aspects of singing a cappella - tone, harmony, pitch and rhythm. No one will be asked to sing alone or to solo, but there will opportunity for those who are so inclined.

This Meetup is open to the general public of all ages. Ed requests that you have some prior experience singing or at least a modicum of ability as a cappella singing can be challenging.

Ed brings a wealth of experience to his events. He was an early pioneer in the world of contemporary a cappella having performed and recorded extensively with his multi-award winning a cappella quartet, The EDLOS. Ed, besides having conducted community choruses and a cappella workshops,  is also a voice teacher and vocal coach with over 20 years experience and teaches lessons privately.
results.name: Middlesex County A Cappella

results.description:
Hello, my name is Tommy Danger Kim and this is my friend-working group. It's not a formal (read: awkward) professional networking group, and it's not a mindless drink-and-party douchefest, either. 

I just want a monthly event where I can meet my friends and catch-up over a drink after work. Since I'm a socialable guy and I'm from out-of-town myself, I want to open this to new New Yorkers as well. I know what it's like to have a clean slate socially and to start over! 

And if you're an original New Yorker who's bitter and hardened by the city, you are totally welcome to join because I like you already. This will be a nice format to meet new people on a regular basis. 

Hope to see you soon. Cheers! 
-Danger

p.s. If you're an avid Facebook user (ahem, procrastinator), you can check out what I do here.

results.description:
Are you a women, age 50 or over, with a sense of adventure and a “bucket list” of things you’d like to experience? 

Do you have a desire to connect and make new friends with like minded women our age?

Are you looking for a place to share good times doing the things you’ve always loved?

If so, you’ve come to the right place!  Baby Boomer Women Social is a group designed to foster lasting friendships among vibrant, spirited women who have a desire to partcipate in a wide range of activities that pique our interests, expand our horizons, rejuvenate our minds and bodies, and unleash our passions. 

• Discover your "inner artist" at an Art and Wine Party …

• Escape for a weekend “self-renewal” retreat  …

• Bring out your "zany side" during an afternoon of improv …

• Enjoy dinner and the theater or a lively game of BUNCO over drinks and hors d’eourves …

• Spend a rejuvenating day at the spa … 

• Learn what it’s like to dance like a Rockette … 

• Try something a little more daring like parasailing (or cheer the group on from a seat in the boat) … 

• Share your passion for Impressionism during a trip to the art museum or your love of Puccini during a night at the opera ... 

• Join us in an activity that sparks your imagination or just sounds like fun!

In the words of Eleanor Roosevelt, “The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” 

PLEASE NOTE: Baby Boomer Women Social is a friendly, supportive, fun-loving group of women that has traditionally had an "open door" policy when it comes to membership. Unfortunately, this policy was abused by some unscrupulous individuals.  We were able to obtain sufficient information to allow Meetup to identify those individuals and ban them from the site.  However, after careful consideration and at the suggestion of Meetup's Trust and Safety Team, new policies have been implemented in an effort to protect the privacy and security of our members from unwelcome and inappropriate solicitation going forward to the extent that it is possible on the Internet, and in an effort to allow all members of our group to socialize and communicate freely with one another without fear of harassment.  To that end, effective June 16, 2015, women who are interested in joining our group must first request to become a member and be approved before gaining access to our site. When you request to become a member of Baby Boomer Women Social, you will simply be asked to answer a few brief questions and upload an appropriate photo of yourself. Photos of animals, flowers, signs, "stock photos", portions of your body (i.e., your eye) or photos that mask your face and/or make it impossible to identify you are not considered appropriate. Regretfully, any request that fails to provide appropriate answers and an appropriate photo will be denied. 

     This is by no means an indication that Baby Boomer Women Social is a "cliquish" group. Indeed, we welcome new members and we hope that these new policies will not deter you from joining us!
results.name: Baby Boomer Women Social: To Enrich the Midlife Journey

results.description: The “INSIGHT CAFE” is a safe, fun, social conversation group where members gather to explore and discuss thought-provoking topics such as “What IS our purpose in life?” or “The meaning of MY existence”. Members (“Wonderers”) are provided with ther resources to create or reformulate their personalized "Magic P. I. L. L." (Purpose In Life Legacy). While ideas and viewpoints from fields that include psychology, philosophy, sociology, religion, science - even the metaphysical, are open to discussion, no formal or specialized knowledge is required to participate. All that's requested is that you have a sense of curiosity, be open-minded, and respectful of other members' opinions and feelings. Meetings will include: open discussions, informative multi-media presentations, special guest speakers, and “Q and A” sessions on related topics and issues. Attendees will also discover “sources for resources” which they can review, with the opportunity to purchase, materials or services they deem interesting, entertaining, or beneficial. Best of all, the opportunity to relate to others and form new friendships (possibly meaningful, long-lasting relationships) is definitely not out of the question either!

results.description:
The Pleasure Salon was founded in 2007 to build community, allowing sex-positive people to cross-pollinate. Our gatherings bring together members of the BDSM, swinger, alternative gender, LGBTQ, sex educator, nudist, sex-magic, polyamory, Pagan, radical faerie, tantra, sex-blogger, porn, pervert and sex-worker communities, and others whose passion is sex. We hold monthly gatherings which are ideal places to meet others, whether you're new to New York City, or just looking to meet like-minded people.

Through building networks in the pleasure-positive community, Pleasure Salon hopes to help create a sex-positive world. It is a place for the open exchange of ideas. Join us in building New York's pleasure positive community, and bring your like-minded friends to this meet and greet. Pleasure Salon embraces respect, acceptance, and non-judgmental support in this public space. 

You should join us if you:

- have a clear photo of yourself in your profile.

- are willing to submit thoughtful responses to our membership questions

- are willing to talk to interesting people.

- new to an alternative lifestyle and would love to discuss it.

- are interested in belonging to a great community.

results.description: This groups mission is to meet the group-running needs of those who do not work normal 9-5 hours and still want to participate in the enormous New York group running culture. I began marathon running in 2010 and consider running a bit of an obsession. After starting a job in management consulting, I found it difficult to consistently attend any existing running group sessions, as most did not accommodate my unique working hours. I tend to hit the pavement by 6am for morning runs, an after 8pm for post-work runs. I also live and work in the financial district, and have found few groups who meet in my neighborhood. This group will meet rather early or late, depending on the day, for group runs at moderate (weekend warrior) pace runs. We will run primarily out-and-back and loop runs that start and end in the financial district, and can be more creative on weekend runs. The goal is to accommodate athletes who work abnormal hours and provide the valuable benefits of a running community for those with even the most demanding work schedule.
results.name: NY After-Hours Runner

Hello! If you live in Elmhurst or nearby area and are interested in having playdates for your children, meeting other parents, perhaps build a long-lasting friendship, come join us. Most of our playdates are at home, but we also do outdoor activities as well. We usually try to have an educational playdate. We read books at all of our home playdates. Feel free to suggest a meetup.


We ask that you attend a minimum of one event every 2 months on any meetup that we organize. We are looking to build a close group of parents so it is required that you attend at least once in 2 months. We understand that you have other commitments as well, but members who do not attend on might be removed. Emergencies aside, if you RSVP "Yes" please attend (no one likes a "no show") or change your RSVP to "No" with enough time for the others to see (12 hours or more in advance). Be considerate that we often purchase/prepare materials ahead of time based on the number of RSVPs. We also require that you add an actual picture of yourself and/or your child.


Please note: By accepting membership to this group, you are agreeing to bear the sole responsibility for your child/ren's safety and comfort at all events. Regardless of the presence of other mothers at meetups, it is required that you watch your own child/ren. We, the organizers as well as meetup.com, are not and cannot be held responsible for any injuries or altercations at any playgroup event.

THANK YOU!

results.description:
Welcome to Tinkergarten Manhattan! 

Do you wonder if the unbridled, outdoor play that used to be part of the fabric of growing up has been lost? At Tinkergarten, we know that is where true learning happens, so we’re here to bring it back!

As a member of this group, you'll be invited to join us for free trial classes and special events in Central Park, and other parts of the city. You'll meet other parents who believe in learning through play and outdoor adventure. We'll also share outdoor DIY activity ideas, and let you know about new classes  starting in your area.

Those who have been members for a while will note that we began as Tinkergarten Central Park - UWS & UES.  We intended to use the group to share outdoor DIY activity ideas, and inform people about upcoming classes, including free events in Central Park for UWS and UES families (and those willing to travel). 

The good news? We're going to keep doing all of that -- we're just expanding our reach so we can share Tinkergarten with more kids and families, in more parts of the city we love.

We'd love you to join our community. Then, take your kids outside and play!

To get ideas for fun outdoor activities: http://www.tinkergarten.com

If you're interested in leading classes at your community: http://tinkergarten.com/leader/

To get in touch, email kate@tinkergarten.com

results.description:
Anyone who follows the daily happenings of technology knows that it’s fascinating and debate inducing. The constant headlines of change and disruption is enough to leave anyone with more questions than answers.

While its natural to internalize and apply ones thinking to his/her own interests, experts agree that it's also important to understand a view that is larger than that which transcends our own interests. The Lower Manhattan Tech MeetUp is an event where we encourage a community of entrepreneurs, investors and professional service providers, among others, in New York City to learn, think about and have dialogue on technology’s future impact on society. How will driverless cars affect the insurance industry? Is space exploration a needed component to our nations future? Is there such thing as privacy?

In order to reach an understanding, the Lower Manhattan Tech MeetUp invites our country’s foremost experts to tackle these topics. But we also need YOU, to bring your background and point of view. This MeetUp is not meant to answer all the questions and solidify the solutions, rather its purpose is to foster the conversations and facilitate discussions around the topics.

If you're an entrepreneur, tech professional, or anyone genuinely interested how technology will affect society, this MeetUp is an opportunity to listen and learn, exchange ideas and network with liked-minded individuals.

We hope you will join us. Stay tuned for our first monthly meetup happening soon!
results.name: Lower Manhattan Tech MeetUp

results.description: Looking for something to do with that special someone to spice up your date night? Want to meet members of NYC's fantastic tango community? Whether you've been dancing forever or are taking your first steps with our group, NYC Date Nights Out is a great way to meet the fun and friendly members of the city's tango community and dance the night away at one of our many gatherings. Hosted by Strictly Tango NYC, New York's premiere dance school, NYC Date Nights Out is a perfect way for a couple to add some magic to their nights.
results.name: NYC Date Nights Out

results.description: -New York's Own- Standard Car Club Welcome to the Standard Car Club; a place where any passionate car lover, connoisseur, and enthusiast can show off their ride. Be it your daily driver, winter beater, weekend warrior, or garage queen; bring it around to a meet and introduce yourself and your car. With this club I want to bring together the car enthusiasts of New York in an environment outside of the typical car meetup group. Although this club loves the finer and more exotic vehicles in the world what we also love is the car of the everyday man and woman, the car with great story and a great owner. This group is for anyone who was a burning passion for cars and you do not even need a car to join.
results.name: Standard Car Club

results.description: “This is a group for anyone interested in Art and Technology, particularly Game Design, Virtual Reality, Digital Art, Multimedia Design, 3D Printing and Makerspaces. Our goal with this meetup is to promote the open collaboration of artists and tech driven individuals and provide a creative platform to learn, share, create and connect. We have a lot planned for this group and we hope you can join the collective.”
results.name: LaunchNJ: Art & Tech Collective

results.description: We are the first community of Technology Bootcamp Graduates whose members are drawn from all of New York's Code Schools and Academies.  Bootcamp alumni newbies, veterans, and everyone in between are welcome.  Future meetups will include insightful, high-caliber speakers, new types of hackathons, and networking sessions with potential employers.  Come join the community to brush up on your skills, learn about the tech scene from industry insiders, and build your stakehold in our Digital City.  If there are any topics you'd like us to focus on, please let us know.  We're here to help you Learn It. Do It. Share It.
results.name: New York Tech Bootcamp Graduates

results.description:
This group is for anyone interested in healthy eating and weight loss.
Lets meet up and learn about healthy food together.  We will be learning  about  new health and nutrition topics each meetup. You should join this meet up if you are looking to improve your health and eating habits.
results.name: Eat Well Workshops

This experience will introduce you to a new avenue which could have been lost or seemed unattainable. Theta brainwaves help you to grow health wellness and abundance. It reignites the power and knowledge which you already possess. It has helped people with grave diseases as well children and youth with special needs to attain their true potential. Women and Men have come out of their old patterns and rediscovered their life potential. Come join us and Let's Grow Together.....
results.name: Alternative Energy  Healing Meetup

topics.name: Meet other Redditers and shoot the SH%#

results.description:
An exclusive group for those that reside in Brooklyn and possess the skill-sets required to create awesome stuff.


We will try and meetup once a month at a bar in Brooklyn.  Only creators can attend, no recruiting will take place since this group is invite only.


I'm creating this group for those that want to hang out with like minded people in similar industries that don't want to deal with the hassle of talking with amateurs or recruiters.


The kind of people I hope that join are:

• Software developers with apps that are in production and used by hundreds of thousands.  

• Hardware creators with products used by thousands.
results.name: The Brooklyn Creators Club

results.description: I've been fascinated with Sherlock Holmes since an early age. I want to have fun activities and discussions with other Sherlock Holmes enthusiasts in the New York area.  Who should join?  Sherlock Holmes enthusiasts, armchair detectives, mystery fans, old souls longing for the gaslight era, anyone interested in Sherlock Holmes or the mystery genre...  You should join if you want to have fun and share discussions with other Sherlock Holmes and mystery fans and perhaps improve your powers of deduction.  We will meet up to discuss Sherlock Holmes stories original and new, do fun activities (scavenger hunts, murder mysteries), maybe even some self improvement (discuss books such as Mastermind: How to Think Like Sherlock Holmes).  Perhaps we will browse The Mysterious Bookshop then discuss The Greek Interpreter over Greek food? Or have a cozy movie night watching Sherlock Holmes movie interpretations? Or share a pint and discuss our favorite Sherlock Holmes' story at one of many Irish/English pubs in the area?  Maybe we will take a carriage ride through Central Park to discuss Sherlock Holmes' typical mode of transportation?  Join us and see where it goes.
results.name: New York Irregulars

results.description: This is a group for everyone to connect -wherever you are! Internationals, transplants and expats welcome, whether you're on the opposite coast of US or on the opposite side of the planet. It's for people traveling that would like someone to show them around or meet up in a group. It's for Lonely Planet/Nomad travelers to feel welcome in a faraway place. It's for people to meet others to travel with whether for a weekend road trip or an extended backpacking international trip. It's for those looking to practice their language skills, learning about other cultures and socializing. It's for adventures both indoors and outdoors. Only rules are: have a clear photo of yourself up (so we recognize you in person), be courteous and take rsvp'ing seriously, and of course be awesome! Spontaneity is encouraged!
results.name: International Connection Travel Meetup NYC & world

results.description: Hi everyone! I'm Francesca - a 45 year old mom living in Maplewood. As a plus-sized woman, it's harder for me to find a network of like-minded women who come across the same challenges as I do in life... everything from shopping for clothes, to fitting in movie theater seats, to exercise. Resources for larger women are slim to none (pun intended!). Therefore, I want to create a network of plus sized women that are a RESOURCE FOR EACH OTHER. I want to build strong friendships, have fun with people who feel comfortable around each other, and provide an ample shoulder to lean on when times get tough. THIS GROUP IS NOT FOR BBW ADMIRERS!! This group is for plus sized women who want to do the following with each other: - shopping... at stores where clothes fit us! - fun outings... where the activity level fits our needs and abilities! - movies... with people who understand that we need a seat in between each other, and don't feel weird about it! - dinner out... without anyone looking at your plate and wondering if you should "really be eating that!" - fitness...without judgement, at a pace and level that works for each person! - FEEL FREE TO BE 100% WHO WE ARE AROUND EACH OTHER! I live in Maplewood but work in Piscataway, so meet ups will be in central & Northern NJ, as well as NYC, which I LOVE! Looking forward to meet you!
results.name: BBW Having Fun & Making Friends (Women Only)

results.description:
Queens Distance Runners  training runs for all levels. Queens Distance Runners exists to help athletes improve their distance running through training focused in Queens. Whether that is a 5k, 10k, Half or Full Marathon, come out and train with QDR! Whatever level, whatever pace, if you are looking to just get started or just need some company along the way- These runs can offer you all of that and more.

This year I celebrate my 10th year as a runner! I have met the most amazing and inspiring people AND I have made great friends. The running community is a very generous one and I have gained so much by being part of this wonderful community. If you know anyone who is interested in joining up send them my way!
results.name: Queens Distance Runners Group Runs- All levels welcome

results.description:
(Please read the description below completely . Thanks) 

We're a diverse group of women of all backgrounds, races, and walks of life, who just so happen to feel more comfortable in the “cool” crowd... if you know what I mean.

I plan on keeping this group uber small, and the events even smaller, so to improve your chances of acceptance, show us your personality by answering all profile questions to the best of your ability, and by including a clear photo of yourself.

Don't let the title fool you in to thinking we're not about making bona fide friendships; hopefully friendships that go way beyond meetup.

Requirements

• Must be attractive - I'm obviously not talking super model gorgeous here. I just mean cute and well put together. Don't be intimated to join. This is a sisterhood!

• Must upload clear, close, and recent photo of yourself as well as answer all questions.  (No pics of babbling brooks or rolling hills, although, I'm a sucker for pretty landscapes.)

• Must be between the ages of 21-35ish :)

• Must be fun and outgoing. (Sorry, No wallflowers). Only POSITIVE, upbeat personalities please.

• Must be sweet, caring, and willing to form genuine friendships.

• Must not be socially awkward in a group setting. 

• Must not be self-absorbed, rude or anything else in that vein. This isn't a group for mean girls, just a group of women who truly want to form genuine relationships, whether we're hitting a club, picnicking in the park, or hanging out at one another's apartments.

• MUST BE AN ACTIVE MEMBER. The point is to actually see you. This is a small group, so inactive members will be deleted after TWO Months.

Let's just have fun in the city! Please Join.
results.name: Young, Fun, and Attractive Women in the City

results.description: As expecting professional women in NYC, we must balance the joys of pregnancy with work. It's not an easy task but we are expected to do it without excuses. On top of that, most employers want us to network and bring in business. Being a first time mom and an attorney, it's difficult to network as all the events involve alcohol and things I cannot do. I hope this group will allow us professional pregnant women to network while having fun doing pregnant friendly activities. Please join!
results.name: Pregnant Professionals

results.description: nycTIES is a non-profit service organization comprised of young professionals committed to building strong ties within the NYC community through philanthropic giving and leadership. We develop partnerships with local charities, addressing a range of causes and have amazing social, volunteer and fundraising events throughout the year. We also provide young professionals in NYC with the unique opportunity to take on leadership roles in planning, organizing and managing events and to build a strong professional network in the city. Check out our website to learn more: http://nycties.org/
results.name: nycTIES: Young Professionals Volunteering in NYC

results.description: A group for families interested in spending quality time in the great outdoors connecting with nature. Join us as we have fun together, unplug, unwind and make new friends! We plan to meet monthly (or more) to hike, skate, sled, swim, play pick-up games, etc. Not exclusive to the Blue Rock School community. All families with a passion for outdoor adventure are welcome!
results.name: The Big Backyard Club of Blue Rock School

results.description: Interested in learning new skills and networking with others in the social sector? Connect with us so you can do more for your cause.
results.name: Foundation Center New York

results.description:
This is a place where professionals and recruiters in the AFC industries (Accounting, Finance and Accounting）meet and hang out with each other. You don't need to be a job-seeker to be a part of us, and a network of experienced recruiters will tell you what other opportunities are available for more effective career planning. For recruiters, meet talents and start building relationships through candid conversations. It's a platform for all of you to find your best next :)

If you have any questions regarding the finance/accounting industry or this group, please feel free to contact me at leslie.chen@projectcrowd.club.
results.name: Accounting & Finance: Recruiter and Professional Mixer

results.description:
We embrace the embodiment of self  love and physical conditioning by, offering Pole Dance lessons and workouts.    We employ certified pole dance instructors to invoke your sexy side through the art of dance  in a non-judgmental environment.

Whether it be a naughty Girls Night Out, Bachelorette Party or a re-invigorating Spa Day. We have all that you’ll ever need to have a memorable time. We go through great lengths to assure you that your experiences with DG novelties are some of the best you’ll ever have.  Call us today!
results.name: DG, LLC

topics.name: Vegan and Vegetarian Dish Parties and Dinners

results.description: Living in or near Westchester and raising kids vegetarian is sometimes a challenge. We hope to create a fun group of alternatively minded “foodies”, with an ethical consciousness towards eating. We would like to meet other vegetarians, vegans or (wannabee’s) and those who are raising vegetarian kids. We will to go to veg restaurants, potlucks, and share ideas. We welcome people who are committed to a lifestyle that supports a healthy environment and the humane treatment of all animals.
results.name: Vegetarian and Vegan Families Westchester Meetup

results.description:
Do you appreciate great wines and great films? Why not enjoy them both in one evening in good company?

We'll meet in wine bars, restaurants for some good tasting before or after a cinema visit.  

Members with wide-screen tv who are willing to host a small event are especially encouraged!
results.name: Wine & Film in New York

results.description: Runners United NYC is a place to make active friendships. This group’s mission is to create an organic community which transcends running and dives into sustainable connections. We are more social than competitive but we train for results, an inclusive place for any one starting alone, or an elite team competitor looking for social running or small group looking for a larger community. We run all of the events in NYC and the majority of the out of town 5K, 10K, triathlons & marathons as well. We have a very active chat on Facebook and we welcome you to join us there. We encourage our members suggest events and outings, we love anything active including hiking, cycling, skiing, swimming and everything fun including night life.
results.name: Runners United NYC

results.description:
A Cutting Edge stylish community for those who LOVE fashion. That are interested in being introduced to Whats next & WHATS TRENDING  such as : Restaurant openings, Great shopping, Events and more.

Be the first to hear about new fashion trends. RSVP to major industry events; special beauty seminar & expos. As we grow as a community there will be opportunities to work together; support & build on business goals as a team.

Please take a moment and fill out the profile questions. Also sign up to our Face Book page:  https://www.facebook.com/NOWTRENDINGNYC

And follow us on Instagram

Now Trending is where it's at for 2015
results.name: Now Trending NYC

Enjoy our fun and educational walking tours around the five boroughs of New York City! 

Photo: NY Times
results.name: New York Walking Tours Meetup

results.description:
I have a vision, to take people with inspiring talent and bring them together to build amazing things. Alone we are strong but together we are unstoppable. Here is an example of a startup circle: 1 go-getting sales shark, 1 app developing ninja, 1 glorious designer and 1 marketing genius. 

How it works:  

1. Join to be part of a startup circle. 
2. Each startup circle is made up of people with skills that can add value in the following areas. Your skills will be verified.

- Marketing/Sales Professional 
- Website Developer 
- Mobile Developer 
- Data Engineer 
- Designer 
- Investor

3. Only 1 person per skill can join a startup circle. 

Once a startup circle is full we can set up a google hangout or meet in order to connect,network and form synergies...maybe even start a project together.

If you like this concept, join me!
results.name: NYC Startup Circles (Organized Brain Trusts)

results.description: Are you looking to meet people and have a few laughs during a fun night out? This is the group for you. We host fun comedy nights in the city and in Brooklyn, that include drinks and a fun comedy show featuring comedians from MTV, Comedy Central and late night shows for low or no cost.
results.name: NYC Live Comedy with Friends

results.description: We are passionate foodies who believe that New York City's unique culinary culture is best paired with its world class art scene. Our adventures will take us to Broadway plays, brasseries, art galleries, legendary bars, indie films and many other places. Our first meetup will be in late February; will you join us?
results.name: Foodies For Art
